title: Director, Customer Insights, Research and CRM
summary: Overview  Become the newest member of the Sprouts Farmers Market Family  As Director of Research, Customer insights and CRM you will be responsible for growing revenue across multiple channels through strategies and tactics designed to acquire, retain and reward customers across all customer segments, driving incremental trips and basket spend and driving customer loyalty. You will be responsible for distilling customer feedback, basket analytics and research into customer insights that cross-functional partners in Marketing, Merchandising, Operations and eCommerce can act upon to improve the customer experience and optimize Sprouts’ customer engagement, business operations and financial results.  This highly visible – brand new – and exciting opportunity will play a critical role in the development and rollout of our new CRM and loyalty strategy, managing and analyzing customer and transaction data to help make key business decisions and promote customer loyalty. You are a strategic and operational leader who thrives and excels when responsible for planning and execution of loyalty and CRM programs across multiple customer touch points. You will be instrumental in ensuring integrity of customer information, developing actionable analytic and research plans, and executing timely and high quality deliverables in a fast-paced environment. In this position, you will serve as a change agent by uncovering consumer and shopper insights for Sprouts and most importantly, convert those insights into actionable recommendations for the business.  Customer-first has been a long-standing priority for Sprouts, since opening our first store in 2002. Our commitment to inspire, educate and empower customers throughout their healthy living journey is no small task and one that we do not take lightly. There are three broad skills that we are looking for in a candidate for this role: a) Strategic thought leadership (to partner with the Strategy, Business Intelligence, Brand/Category, Merchandising and Operations teams to define the key initiative for short-, medium- and long-term growth of customer engagement and brand differentiation; b) Ability to translate research, analytics and insights into actions across the enterprise (in-store and out of store customer engagement, key segment and customer journey initiatives, category and product innovation, competitive edge, et al); c) Passion and expertise in innovation and collaboration (both being critical leadership qualities for strategic growth of the enterprise).  We expect, that through actions and example, you will ensure that Sprout’s vision and values are incorporated into business strategies. Part of your responsibilities will also be to play an active role in the research and customer insights community and develop our organizational muscle memory and discipline around ongoing research and insights work, Your focus and leadership with strengthen our ability to develop innovative approaches/tool-kits, assert influence, and have an impact in contributing bench strength to support Sprouts’ leadership, influence, and growth in this dynamic, fast-paced, growth sector of healthy grocery. Essential Functions How You Will Make a Difference Define and manage the loyalty promotions and future programs to including promotion/program structure(s), roadmaps, benefits, promotion/program economic metrics management, as well as conceptualizing, in partnership with Business Intelligence and IT teams, the data architecture and CRM automation needed to support long-term goals. Conceptualize and drive CRM activation plans and optimization strategies. Responsible for creating and implementing customer contact optimization strategies targeted to customer acquisition and retention, across new, emerging and existing markets. Manage periodic and ongoing research initiatives to support, validate and define customer segmentation, competitive positioning, department/category strategies and other business needs, as defined by cross-functional partners. Define framework and build requirements for the loyalty promotion/program technology and partner in data infrastructure needed to support long-term growth, partnering cross-functional teams. Drive revenue and customer engagement through customer on-boarding, acquisition, reactivation, retention and loyalty initiatives. Feed retail and digital insights into the organization to provide retail expertise, including trends, category management, promotions and merchandising. Oversee, track and analyze applicable programs to ensure efficiency and effectiveness of programs. Directs efforts of Loyalty and CRM vendors and other third party contractors. Partner with cross-functional teams, sharing learnings and knowledge to support the business needs. Collaborate with Business Intelligence team for segmentation and customer data maintenance. Knowledge, Skills, Abilities and Physical Requirements What should I bring to the table? 8-10 years Consumer & Shopper Insights – Grocery/Health or high customer-frequency environments/brands preferred A Bachelor's degree in business, economics or social science fields (e.g., psychology, anthropology). Master's Degree (MBA) strongly preferred. Strong understanding of consumer insights, retail and digital experience, merchandising and sales. 5+ years of progressive experience in quantitative marketing disciplines, including at least 2 years in a relevant leadership position Experience must include a combination of CRM/Database, Marketing, and Market Analysis, and a blend of proven strategic and tactical capabilities Quantitative and qualitative research experience, including management of an ongoing proprietary or third-party panel. Multi-channel retail industry experience strongly preferred Experience in influencing a diverse and creative group of individuals and leading change. Must have a track record in establishing procedures, implementing processes and executing initiatives.Skills Strong strategic thinking, problem-solving, and analytical skills with the ability to turn findings into actionable recommendations and plans are critical Strong mathematical aptitude and quantitative skills In-depth knowledge of best practices, tools, and methodologies for customer marketing research, insights and analytics Ability to work professionally with flexibility in handling multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment. Demonstrate a proven effective formula for managing complex projects as well as be able to show how projects are managed and how results are communicated. Active listening skills and ability to synthesize and interpret information and respond appropriately Strong interpersonal and communication skills to engage and influence Team player and collaborative style to build relationships cross-functionally and at all levels of the organization Benefits In addition to a rewarding career, Sprouts offers a comprehensive program to help support you and your family. These programs include: Competitive pay Opportunities for career growth 15% discount for you and one other family member in your household on all purchases made at Sprouts Flexible schedules Employee Assistance Program (EAP) Eligibility requirements may apply for the following benefits: 401(K) Retirement savings plan with a generous company match Affordable benefit coverage, including medical, dental vision Pre-tax Flexible Spending Accounts for healthcare and dependent care Company paid life insurance and short-term disability coverage Why Sprouts Grow with us! If you have a passion for inspiring people and a flair for fresh food, consider applying for a job at Sprouts! With a focus on customer service, our neighborhood grocery stores offer high-quality, farm fresh produce, natural meats, plenty of scoop-your-own bulk goods and much more in a fun, friendly, old-fashioned farmer’s market setting. Come grow your career in healthy living with a fast-paced, rapidly growing company and teams that pride themselves on empowering others along their journey.  The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of the work being performed by people assigned to this work. This is not an exhaustive list of all duties, responsibilities, and requirements. Sprouts’ management reserves the right to amend and change duties, responsibilities, and requirements to meet business and organizational needs as necessary.  SM123 CB123

title: Analytics Manager, Product Consumer Insights
summary: Netflix is seeking a talented and creative analytics leader to help optimize the Netflix product experience, focusing on elevating the quantitative analytic capabilities of our consumer insights team. This is a high-impact position where your methodological expertise, statistical rigor and interpretation of results will inform decisions affecting millions of users and help drive competitive advantage. The role covers a broad range of the consumer journey, from acquisition and retention, to new feature innovation. You and your small team will be part of the larger consumer insights group that focuses on primary research and will collaborate closely with other teams analyzing data from various sources. You will have a direct and immediate impact on the business. Responsibilities Partner with research leads to design, analyze and interpret sophisticated quantitative primary research Drive innovation by via a broad toolkit of methodologies and statistical techniques that could sharpen or speed up our decision-making processes. Proactively perform data exploration to understand underlying consumer motivations, needs and opportunities for improving the experience for members and non-members. Synthesize survey data and behavioral data (along with other inputs) to gain a comprehensive understanding of our consumers. Manage a small team of analysts Qualifications 10+ years of hands-on experience in consumer insights / market research on the client and/or agency side. Advanced degree in Statistics, Econometrics, or a related quantitative field Analytics expert: Strong aptitude for working with data and advanced statistics (segmentation, discrete choice, etc.) Agile with large amounts of data (qualitative, quantitative, behavioral, secondary, etc.) - determining what’s important and distilling it into actionable insights without getting caught up in analysis paralysis. Able to synthesize across multiple sources into a clear and concise story. Strong data visualization skills to convey quantitative results clearly Thrive on wanting to know why consumers act and feel the way they do, love sharing this understanding with others, and be known for accurately predicting consumer behavior and reaction. Track record as a thought leader and contributing to breakthrough innovation. Strong business acumen is critical. Highly collaborative with colleagues and business partners alike, as well as strong leadership skills to oversee a small team. Straightforward, honest and succinct communicator. Can organize, clarify and communicate complex ideas quickly, succinctly and accurately. Past experience in a culture that utilizes big data and experimental approaches (e.g. A/B testing) is a plus. Deep global research experience understanding nuances in optimizing survey approaches and analyses across diverse cultural markets.

title: Analyst, Gradient Ventures
summary: Gradient Ventures is a venture fund investing in promising, early-stage startups, providing AI innovators with funding, resources, and dedicated access to world-class people and practices in AI.   The fund focuses on helping founders navigate technical challenges in developing AI-based products. As an analyst on the Gradient Ventures team, you focus on assessing investments and contribute key insights to drive intelligent investment decisions. You represent Gradient Ventures and its portfolio in meetings with leaders at Google and externally, and you cultivate relationships with key partners based on a deep understanding of Gradient Ventures portfolio companies. You also work collaboratively across functions (including Legal, Finance, Marketing, PR/Communications and People Operations).   You provide the management team with the needed insight to drive intelligent, sound decision-making. You bring strong quantitative skills, strategic thinking and sound business judgment, along with the ability to think about what is -- and what could be. By supporting the development of relationships with rising stars in the tech community, venture capital firms and investment banks, you help grow Gradient Ventures.   Google is and always will be an engineering company. We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to take on some of technology's greatest challenges and make an impact on millions, if not billions, of users. At Google, engineers not only revolutionize search, they routinely work on massive scalability and storage solutions, large-scale applications and entirely new platforms for developers around the world. From AdWords to Chrome, Android to YouTube, Social to Local, Google engineers are changing the world one technological achievement after another.   Responsibilities Work with the investment team to identify and develop investment theses, and provide financial analysis of potential investments. Track agreement sourcing activities and pipeline of new investment opportunities. Initial review and preparation of summary materials for potential new investment opportunities. Monitor financial performance of select portfolio companies.  Qualifications Minimum qualifications: BA/BS degree in finance, Mathematics, Engineering, Science, related field or equivalent practical experience. Venture Capital, Investment Banking, Internet, Incubator/Accelerator and/or technology industry experience.  Preferred qualifications: Strong financial modeling, writing and presentation skills. Excellent quantitative and qualitative analytical skills. Passionate about helping new technology grow at scale to change the world for better. Exceptional interpersonal skills, business judgment and work ethic.

title: Strategy Analytics Manager
summary: Redefine How Washington Works When government is at its best, diverse ideas are at work. The same is true of Bloomberg Government. Our ability to innovate and serve our clients means diversity and inclusion are essential. If you’re eager to join a multi-dimensional team that celebrates and leverages difference, if you have the vision to see how information can transform “business as usual” and if you are hungry to create-to build a service transforming how things get done—then stop reading this and join our team.   Who Thrives Here?  Individuals who embrace hard work, act with urgency and collaborate without reserve thrive at Bloomberg Government. You are on the front lines of revolutionizing the information services industry in Washington-as high as our expectations will be of you, yours must be higher. If you are dogged, innovative and interested in work that contributes to causes greater than yourself, you belong at Bloomberg Government.  Bloomberg BNA also provides legal, tax and compliance professionals with critical information, practical guidance and workflow solutions. We leverage leading technology and a global network of experts to deliver a unique combination of news and authoritative analysis, comprehensive research solutions, innovative practice tools, and proprietary business data and analytics. Bloomberg BNA is an affiliate of Bloomberg L.P., the global business, financial information and news leader. Bloomberg Government provides congressional, regulatory and legal news to government affairs and government relations professionals. The Strategy Analytics Manager, BGOV works with confidential operational, product, content and sales data to assess financial performance and support management business decisions on initiatives across the organization, as well as provides support for various projects led by the Director of Product and Operations Strategy. RESPONSIBILITIES: Serve as a project manager to guide, inform, and work on various projects across the business that may include assessment and development of commercial strategy, operational effectiveness, product and content direction and organizational structure. Conduct research and analysis independently in support of company strategies, strategy planning processes, and/or key operational issues. Translate research and analysis into business implications insights, and provide suggestions for driving improvements. Take results to a logical and relevant end product, with some supervision. Contribute to and leads the creation of deliverables, including reports, spreadsheets, presentations and other outputs to document and communicate findings. Work independently, receiving general instruction on day-to-day work and general instructions on new assignments with a focus on tasks and self-contained work streams. Participate in special projects and perform other duties as assigned. REQUIREMENTS: 3+ years’ of relevant business experience; strong organizational, follow-up, and project management skills required; strategic mindset with proven analytical and quantitative skills; proven ability to discover hard to find information and perform research on open/unstructured topics; enthusiastic, action-oriented, strong sense of accountability; strong initiative and resourceful; highly motivated and proactive; excellent communication skills (both written and verbal) and interpersonal skills; proven ability to build relationships and collaborate with others; effective in structuring and self-managing work for multiple projects, constantly re-assessing priorities to meet deadlines; discretion in working with a wide range of sensitive and confidential issues; exceptional Excel and PowerPoint skills;experience with SQL, Tableau and Adobe analytics preferred; prior experience in strategic, marketing, or financial analysis; strategy consulting or business strategy, or statistics experience preferred. Bachelor’s degree with coursework in finance, operations or related field or equivalent experience. MBA degree preferred. Bloomberg BNA IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER and fully subscribes to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity. Bloomberg BNA has adopted an Affirmative Action Program to ensure that all applicants and employees are considered for hire, promotion, and job status without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, sexual orientation, marital or familial status, genetic information, disabled veteran, veteran, veteran of the Vietnam Era, or any other classification protected by law.

title: Manager, Global Strategy and Analytics
summary: Snap Inc. is a camera company. We believe that reinventing the camera represents our greatest opportunity to improve the way people live and communicate. Our products empower people to express themselves, live in the moment, learn about the world, and have fun together.  Snapchat is the camera used by over 150 million people every day to Snap with family, watch Stories from friends, see events from around the world, and explore expertly curated content from top publishers. In short, we are a passionate team working hard to build the best platform in the world for communication and storytelling.  We’re looking for a Sales Operations Manager to join Team Snapchat! Working closely with the Sales Operations team, you will focus on shaping our Sales strategy with actionable insights. Working from our Santa Monica, CA office or our New York, NY office, you will partner closely with our Sales Leadership, Revenue Operations and Product teams to refine our go-to-market strategy by leveraging analysis, market intelligence and a “gut” that’s driven by an intellectually rigorous and curious approach to solving business challenges.  What you'll do:  Consult across Global Sales Leadership on their go-to-market strategy, leveraging actionable insights Partner cross-functionally to build out our data insights knowledge base Create models and synthesize market intel to inform key business decisions Run strategic analysis projects with cross-functional input and global business impact Manage the creation of systematic and scalable analysis on Snapchat’s advertiser ecosystem to inform ad revenue strategies Provide recommendations and solutions to Snap’s sales leadership, Board and C-suite to expand Snap’s advertiser portfolio, grow current client ad spend and inform new market expansion  What we're looking for:  BA/BS degree in a relevant field; MBA is a plus 10+ years experience in a Sales Operations or Consulting role Experience developing analytical systems and tools for large teams, and rolling out these tools at scale Proven business sense and problem solving, project management, and analytical skills In-depth knowledge of digital advertising sales Ability to initiate and drive projects to completion with minimal guidance Excellent written and verbal communication skills Someone who’s comfortable dealing with changing environments and operating under high levels of ambiguity Excellent interpersonal skills to partner cross-functionally Able to work independently as well as collaboratively within a team environment  At Snap, we believe that having a team of diverse backgrounds and voices working together will enable us to create innovative products that improve the way people live and communicate. title: Pricing Analyst
summary: Requisition Title  : Pricing Analyst Job Posting    Position Summary: The Pricing Analyst will lead the Corporate pricing strategy to maximize profitable growth. Creates and publishes dashboards, performing deep dive analyses to provide insight into effectiveness of pricing strategies. Builds pricing models which support the category business plan as well as align with the overall pricing strategy. Modifies pricing models as needed to ensure all pricing objectives are met. Executes strategic pricing for all categories through the utilization of price modeling tools; market price validation, external market share data, and market specific strategic pricing goals. Analyzes modeling outcomes providing insights and suggests potential solutions to issues around sales, margin, and price elasticity. Responsibilities: Leads strategic pricing development and implementation. Develops pricing models and performs quantitative analysis of results to measure product profitability. Performs business case analyses and financial assessments to ensure that chosen initiatives will drive anticipated value to the business. Defines, develops and implements pricing initiatives. As part of the development and deployment of new initiatives, this role will interface with the business to understand where new initiatives will add benefit for revenue growth and margin expansion. Develops pricing policies, including approval policies. Implements a governance process which allows for decision-making and corporate control. Responsible for providing reporting and analysis of pricing information to convert data into metrics, dashboards, and trend analysis. Institutes tools and reporting mechanisms for tracking the performance of the pricing function and to optimize pricing activities. Makes recommendations to Senior Management on pricing strategies; communicates pricing strategy, structure, policies and processes to the organization. Manages intercompany pricing arrangements between related business entities, including all intercompany contracts, service and royalty agreements. Identifies and leads potential process and/or system improvements. Administers the use and functionality of pricing applications and databases. Performs ad hoc analysis. Qualifications  Skills/Qualifications desired: 5+ years of relevant pricing experience. Ability to interpret and extrapolate complex data sets and formulate recommendations. Strong analytical ability with relentless attention to detail. Strong financial modeling skills. Strong customer focus, initiative, attention to detail and problem solving skills. Strong communication skills and demonstrated ability to work with and lead cross-functional teams. Ability to communicate project implications and impacts to broad stakeholders at different levels of the organization. Dymax Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. title: Associate, Data Science
summary: The Pfizer Data Science Team in StratCO Business Analytics (BA) is now looking for talented individuals destined to usher in the next era of healthcare. We live in a moment of remarkable change and opportunity. The scale and convergence of business, research, data, and technology is transforming healthcare, biopharmaceutical, and life sciences organizations today. BA’s Data Science team shapes state-of-the-art new analytic capabilities to drive business transformation. We have several openings for data scientists to help in several ongoing commercial and R&D analytics projects. Responsibilities Mining massive amounts of real-world healthcare, research, and business data to extract useful insights. Capturing and analyzing data from new and novel data sources. Backend data and software engineering to build scalable solutions/algorithms, data pipelines, and helping to automate data processing challenges. Designing new means of communication of predictive modeling results through data visualizations, dashboards, apps, and workshops. Designing new visualizations to make descriptive analyses intuitive and more informative for additional modeling. Assisting in designing and executing predictive modeling projects using rigorous statistical methods and machine learning techniques. Suggesting improvements in the tools and techniques to help scale the team. Requirements 1-2 years experience. BS degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Data Science, Engineering, Operations Research, Applied Mathematics, Physics, Computational Biology, or similar Quantitative Field from a leading academic institution. Some experience/projects involving real-world analytical problems using machine learning, statistical modeling, or similar quantitative approaches. Fluency in SQL or other programming languages (Python, Java, and/or C++) Some development experience in at least once scripting language (PHP, Perl, Python, etc.). Basic understanding of statistical analysis, experience with R, MATLAB, Excel, etc. preferred. A passion for problem-solving, comfort with ambiguity, and creativity. Ability to thrive in a dynamic and fast-paced environment and drive change, and collaborate effectively with a variety of individuals and organization. EEO & Employment Eligibility Pfizer is committed to equal opportunity in the terms and conditions of employment for all employees and job applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, gender identity or gender expression, national origin, disability or veteran status. Pfizer also complies with all applicable national, state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment as well as work authorization and employment eligibility verification requirements of the Immigration and Nationality Act and IRCA. Pfizer is an E-Verify employer. Sunshine Act Pfizer reports payments and other transfers of value to health care providers as required by federal and state transparency laws and implementing regulations. These laws and regulations require Pfizer to provide government agencies with information such as a health care provider’s name, address and the type of payments or other value received, generally for public disclosure. Subject to further legal review and statutory or regulatory clarification, which Pfizer intends to pursue, reimbursement of recruiting expenses for licensed physicians may constitute a reportable transfer of value under the federal transparency law commonly known as the Sunshine Act. Therefore, if you are a licensed physician who incurs recruiting expenses as a result of interviewing with Pfizer that we pay or reimburse, your name, address and the amount of payments made currently will be reported to the government. title: Business Intelligence Analyst
loc: San Francisco, CA 94103 (South Of Market area)
summary: Who We Are:   Twitter users generate many terabytes of data every day; Twitter engineers run hundreds of experiments; Twitter data scientists create increasingly sophisticated models of users and content.   The Analytics team at Twitter is at the intersection of all this data and strives to deliver actionable insights to business units throughout the company. We spearhead important analyses and think of ways to make big data accessible for exploration and decision-making.   As a Business Intelligence Analyst, you will deliver key insights to help grow our business.   What You’ll Do:   You will be a key member of the Analytics team working closely with cross-functional partners around Twitter. In this position, you will provide valuable perspectives to help Twitter reach every person on the planet. As such, you will:  Develop and prove hypotheses to evaluate new growth opportunities and optimize existing business initiatives   Partner with product, marketing, and media teams to develop, prototype, and monitor success of new programs   Become the business analytics subject matter expert to internal and external partners   Communicate results of new initiatives to executives and cross-functional teams   Who You Are:  You are analytically minded and you take organized approaches to problem solving. You break down issues into smaller pieces and have a strong desire to dig into data to guide your thinking   You are a strategic thinker. You’re able to lift up from the analytical tasks and connect the dots to effect change   You are a self-starter who takes initiative and can thrive within a flat team organization   You can pivot from blockers and develop a new approach when there are no precedents   You are a clear and effective communicator   You are personable, approachable, and able to connect with every person on the team and throughout the business   Requirements:  Bachelor's degree from 4-year institution   1-2 years work experience in an analytical role   Strong familiarity with SQL and analytical tools such as Python, R, or Excel   Willingness to learn new tools to access and visualize data   Experience with Tableau is preferred   We are committed to an inclusive and diverse Twitter. Twitter is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based on race, ethnicity, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, veteran, genetic information, marital status or any other legally protected status.   San Francisco applicants:   Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

title: Market Intelligence Analyst, Waze
summary: As a Marketing professional, you are a fully dedicated business leader with the opportunity to shape the future of Waze. You take part in the complete marketing experience as you lead every facet of the product's journey. From determining positioning, naming, competitive analysis, feature prioritization and external communications, you help shape the voice of Waze, while helping it grow and engage its loyal user base. This means you work with a cross-functional team across sales, corporate communications, legal, web, product development, engineering and more. The role will enable you to shape Waze's development process, organize product launches from beginning to end and form future marketing strategy.   At Waze, we leave all egos at the door and concentrate on the job at hand. We value passionate, down to earth, “can do” people who enjoy fine-tuning small details, without losing sight of the big picture. We are looking for the type of person who feels uncomfortable when a day goes by without achieving something impactful. Someone who is driven to get things done and views obstacles as an exciting challenge that demands a creative solution. Above all else, this role requires someone who takes great pride in their work and is inspired and motivated by their role in improving the way millions of people drive worldwide.   You will derive insights from analysis of external data to fuel Waze’s Sales strategy and growth. This includes the ability to gain an in-depth understanding of key market drivers for Waze’s core regions and verticals to support model-based market size and competitive analysis, as well as commissioning custom research studies to answer our most pressing questions around the the role that Waze can play in helping brands to achieve their marketing objectives.   Waze Marketing is responsible for creating the overall Waze experience starting with the brand, messaging, communications, design, social media, multi-media and more. As part of the product team, we work side by side with R&D to initiate and create new projects and products. We strive for simple, leveled up communications and excellent brand management. We are looking for self-starters with an entrepreneurial edge, and a strong inclination towards design and visual.   Responsibilities Create model-based market sizing and forecasting. Become an expert in the competitive landscape for Waze's key verticals and markets. Evaluate research vendors and methodologies. Manage multiple stakeholders.  Qualifications Minimum qualifications: BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience. 5 years of experience working in an analytical role. 3 years of experience working in the advertising or Ad Tech industry.  Preferred qualifications: Experience in consulting. Experience with research study design.

title: Brand Strategist
summary: The role of a Brand Strategist in Marcom is to instigate, inspire and guide the development and execution of exceptional marketing in support of Apple’s business goals. In this role, you will be instrumental in positioning Apple to remain one of the most beloved and empowering brands for both current and potential customers today and into the years to come. Key Qualifications As a part of our strategy team you will bring a deep understanding of, and extensive experience in, marketing strategy, experience design, design research, or brand communications. We value your strong ability and desire to empathize with people of all walks of life from all corners of the globe. You have a track record of leading strategic conversations with a wide range of people in different disciplines. Your deep expertise in partnering with, and building real, productive relationships with creative people who span many fields - advertising, video, interactive, print, retail, is essential for your success. Demonstrated skills in core areas: business and brand strategy, insights and research, media and communications planning Experience of creating productive working relationships with key partners outside of the Marketing function. Extraordinary writing skills, visual story-telling skills and presentation skills. You have a passion for technology along with a critical point of view on its impact on people’s lives. You have 5 - 8 years of strategic brand planning experience at a creative consultancy, or creatively-driven internal marketing team. Description You will be joining a team of Strategists within Marketing Communications (Marcom) who collaborate closely with extraordinary creative talent to launch Apple products, create new customer experiences, and tackle a variety of complex marketing challenges. Using an objective and insights-driven approach, we help refine and connect the Apple brand with current and future customers all over the world.  Specific duties: You will own the translation of business objectives into marketing strategies. Develop creative briefs that inspire our creative teams to deliver effective marketing concepts. Apply your strategic approach to a wide variety of product, communications and experience challenges using a wide variety of tangible outputs. Lead strategic conversations that help rethink and reimagine the way we communicate with customers and potential customers in the world today. As a member of our team you will work closely and productively with some of the best creative talent on the planet. Build relationships and gain insight from diverse groups of people in a variety of disciplines within the larger Apple organization. Draw on many different sources of insight and knowledge to weave together a strong creative narrative. React quickly to new information, opinions and direction and strategically pivot when necessary. Work within a flat hierarchy, be a real person an excellent teammate, supporting other Strategists and non-Strategists to succeed together. Education Bachelor's degree preferred Additional Requirements Creative Advertising or Design Agency experience preferred.  Samples of creative briefs or case study samples required.

summary: Do you have a passion for data and analytics? Do you get excited about knowing the details of a system, data and driving business insight? Do you often ask yourself, what if I had access to key data sources at my fingertips and was empowered to help make sense of it? If so, this role is for you! Job Description The Audit Group is looking for a Senior Data Analyst to join its Technology Enabled Continuous Analytics (TECA) team. TECA is the team responsible for creating data and analytics driven culture within the Audit Group by developing and leveraging existing reporting and analytics resources to support internal audit projects, investigations, and risk management activities. Familiar with data visualization tools like Power BI Proficient with Microsoft BI stack: SSAS, SSRS, SSIS. Demonstrated ability with data mining using SQL, ETL and Data Warehouses 2+ years of industry work experience to implement machine learning models in big data environment Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with hands-on experience applying it to company wide data Ability to collaborate with a variety of teams across the world Strong problem-solving motivations, a team working spirit, and an open mind to take extra steps to make whole projects successful  Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. company: Martin Luther King, Jr. Community Hospital
title: Manager of Data Governance and Population Health Analytics
summary: Reporting to the VP of Population Health the Manager of Enterprise Data Governance and Population Health Intelligence has accountability for the coordination and oversight of databases that support financial, quality, performance improvement, and operational efforts and the achievement of the organization’s strategic Population Health initiatives. The Manager will assess organizational needs and identify internal and external resources necessary to meet needs. Additionally, the Manager will create and implement plans, structure, systems and processes to provide organizational data requirements and support organizational goal attainment in analytics and population health. The Manager will collaborate with all data stakeholders to identify and coordinate the internal center of excellence as a source of truth for reporting. This role encompasses the effective and efficient management of human, fiscal and other resources, compliance with regulatory and professional standards and strategic planning, improvement of quality, service levels, safety, and customer satisfaction and of collaborative relationships. This position requires the full understanding and active participation in fulfilling the Mission of Martin Luther King, Jr. Community Hospital. It is expected that the employee will demonstrate behavior consistent with the Core Values. The employee shall support Martin Luther King, Jr. Community Hospital’s strategic plan and the goals and direction of the Population Health development and the quality and performance improvement process activities.   ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES   Evaluate sources and resources for data; recommend and implement plans for coordination of effort towards the goal of one source of trut Manage and implement population health analytics, strategic initiatives, and healthcare delivery projects. Develop predictive algorithms to determine major risk factors and barriers that negatively impact patient/community health outcomes. Utilize spatial analytics to map out health outcomes, identify statistical trends in outcomes, and make recommendations on allocation of resources. Optimize existing healthcare operations for community and population health projects. Lead development of advanced analytics on population health topics and collaborate with senior management for executive decision support. Research statistical methodologies and identify high quality data sources to produce actionable insights for population health related strategic initiatives. Develop population health metrics specific to track and trend progress of the surrounding community and identify any opportunities for improvement. Present reports, analyses and findings to senior management and others as scheduled or requested. Collaborate with other stakeholders to create an enterprise wide data warehouse Establish standardized vocabulary and patient registries Ensures efficient, accurate, consistent production of reports are available to the organization. Supports clinical, financial, and operational strategic initiatives through accurate data reporting. This includes data reporting requirements for grant funded projects. Contributes to, participates in and leads performance improvement efforts. Recommends program /service changes to increase efficiency and appropriate use of fiscal resources. Develops, revises or reviews policies and procedures related to data governance, required reporting. Operationalizes human resource policies to include behavioral interviewing, credentials compliance, orienting, evaluating, and coaching/counseling, disciplining and terminating staff. Manages and directs staff to ensure systems are meeting Population Health’s needs. Contributes development of Quality and Performance Improvement Plans. Deploys a systematic process to identify, prioritize the issues inhibiting key work flows and quality outcomes in cost effective manner. Organizes and directs work flow, solves intra and interdepartmental problems that inhibit work flow and quality, motivates employees to optimal performance, and serves as a resource to staff for clinical, ethical or systems issues. Involves medical staff in assessing data needs as appropriate. Fosters multi-disciplinary integration of process improvement strategies. Supports systems and report development of report structures that would allow the leaders to run their reports with ease, let the end users generate and analyze the reports they want within parameters. Set up some standard reports for the end users to monitor the process improvements in the individual areas. Provides training and support to make the end users more self-sufficient to run the reports/analysis they may need. Qualifications/Experience   Minimum of five (5) years working in a hospital or clinical setting. Minimum two years management experience. Previous Lean or Six Sigma experience leading process improvement teams preferred   Previous experience in decision support, performance improvement, and data analytics in a leadership role is preferred.   C. Special Skills/Knowledge  Advanced computer skills in use of various software programs related to position Ability to grasp complex operational or clinical processes and apply strong analytical critical thinking and problem solving Understanding of acute care hospital and ambulatory clinical data requirements Deep understanding of various IT tools and resources and ability to assess and address gaps Excellent project management skills Effective listener and influencer skills Strong knowledge of research methodologies and design Data mining skills Spatial analysis experience Advanced analytical, financial and technical skills needed to perform complex analysis and data modeling using sophisticated report writing and data management tools Lean Six Sigma methodologies and implementation strategies for optimization

title: Basketball Analytics Fellow
summary: Title: Basketball Analytics Fellow Department: Analytics, Basketball Operations Reports to: Director, Basketball Analytics  Position Summary: The Basketball Analytics Fellow will be a critical member of the Basketball Analytics team. Supporting the Basketball Analytics team, he or she will take on a variety of statistical and reporting responsibilities, including modeling, analytical team strategy, and streamlining existing or new processes. title: Director of User Research
summary: The Digital Product team at Harry’s is looking for an innovative and passionate Director of User Research to join us in our SOHO office in Manhattan to lead market research, user research and usability studies to help inform, drive and execute on our bold product vision and deliver delightful and thoughtful experiences to guys all over the world to help them prepare for their day, every day.  Harry’s  Harry’s was built out of respect for quality craftsmanship, simple design, modern convenience and most importantly for guys who know they shouldn't have to overpay for a great shave. Like many guys, we’ve long had to choose between over-priced razors that disrespect your intelligence, and cheap razors that disrespect your face. We knew there had to be a better way, so we created Harry’s as a return to the essential: a great shave at a fair price.  To learn more about our story, check out website https://www.harrys.com/our-story ( https://www.harrys.com/our-story )  The Digital Product Team @ Harry’s  At Harrys, the Digital Product team represents the customer, and our mission is to build a powerful, direct-to-consumer experiences that will delight customers and make their lives easier. We are a nimble team with a game-changing mind-set, endless passion and uncompromising user focus. We hone-in on customer needs, ideate the best product and design solutions to serve them, and build user centric experiences. We then launch, measure and iterate on solutions and never settle until we find the right answer for our customers. We are a highly collaborative team that partners cross-functionally to deliver highly performing, maintainable, beautiful customer experiences and always look to improve.  About you  You have insatiable appetite for understanding your business, customer & market, and are relentless in your pursuit of data insights that inform smart product and business decisions; You have exceptional talent in defining and driving usability research and other market research studies and have knack and a passion for mastering new and agile ways and tools to derive insights for the business; You thrive in entrepreneurial and nimble environments, and can both role up your sleeves and sweat the details and tie them back to the big picture; You are a natural-born collaborator, and can work closely with your product and design peers to lead and support different product insights work streams.  Key responsibilities   Understand Harry’s business, customers and product by considering market context, industry and competitive trends, Cx feedback, A/B tests, site metrics, and customer insight findings. Identify key gaps/need areas that require usability and other insight work by both initiating work based on your evaluation, past experience and best practices, and by working with a team of product managers and designers to understand their data and insight needs. Translate research questions into well thought-out research plans and work closely with product to align them with the product roadmap. Distill usability and research findings into actionable insights and plans and communicate these findings to the relevant teams Identify best research methods based on research goals, timeline and resourcing, with emphasis on agility and iterative learning. Deliver high quality user research solutions in an environment with frequently shifting priorities and new market opportunities. Lead improvements in our user research process while creating the right integration points in support of the product and design sprint process. Balance the need for in-depth user research with the need to deliver usability findings in time for sprints, all while remaining nimble and pushing our team on agility Develop and implement user-centered research throughout the design and development cycle using a variety of methodologies including: usability studies, contextual inquiry, task analysis, surveys, personas and other appropriate qualitative and quantitative research techniques. Be a user research thought leader; coach and mentor the product and design teams on user research best practices and trends Work closely with the product and analyst teams to integrate data and analytics insights into the research roadmaps and research findings. Be a strong and vocal user advocate.  Basic Qualifications   8+ years’ experience in user (usability) research and other research domains (market research) in digital product. End-to-end experience driving all aspects of research (study design, recruiting, moderation, analysis, synthesis and reporting). Hands-on experience with the following methods: lab-based user testing, remote testing, field research, and survey design. Analytical and quant skills A strong portfolio demonstrating past work experience and deliverables (including study plans, reports). Excellent communication and presentation skills; the ability to communicate complex concepts clearly and persuasively across different audiences Experience in E-commerce user research Experience in cross-device research (web, mobile web, android and iOs surfaces) Experience in statistical data analysis  Harry’s is committed to bringing together individuals from different backgrounds and perspectives. We strive to create an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive, feel a sense of belonging, and do great work together. As an equal opportunity employer, we prohibit any unlawful discrimination against a job applicant on the basis of their race, color, religion, veteran status, sex, parental status, gender identity or expression, transgender status, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability or genetic information. We respect the laws enforced by the EEOC and are dedicated to going above and beyond in fostering diversity across our company.

title: Corporate Development Analyst
summary: The Corporate Development team holds the reins to much of our worldwide growth. As a member of the Corporate Development team, you work collaboratively across functions (including Legal, Finance and People Operations) to identify and evaluate both acquisition and investment opportunities. You provide the management team with the needed insight to drive intelligent, sound decision-making. You understand the industry landscape and harness it to manage our integration. With an air of humility, you bring strong quantitative skills, strategic thinking and sound business judgment, along with the ability to think about what is -- and what could be.   The Corporate Development team guarantees Google's worldwide growth by identifying the appropriate acquisitions and investments -- and then working to make them happen. Consisting of experienced merger-and-acquisition leaders and integration experts, we're dedicated to identifying the business opportunities of tomorrow. We find and evaluate acquisition opportunities across existing and future markets, drive management team decisions, lead negotiations, and help manage post-acquisition integration and performance evaluation.   Responsibilities Research industry trends, market landscape and internal product development efforts. Identify, evaluate, and value acquisition and strategic investment opportunities. Help drive management team decisions and interface with Google product, engineering and GTM teams. Support consultation sessions and post-acquisition integration.  Qualifications Minimum qualifications: BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience 2 years of experience in corporate development, investment banking, management consulting and/or venture capital/private equity experience in the technology industry.  Preferred qualifications: Internet, communications, e-commerce, and/or cloud experience Google product knowledge and strong cross-functional perspectives. Excellent quantitative and qualitative analytical skills, including experience building financial models and valuing companies. Self motivated, results driven and strong attention to detail; exceptional interpersonal and communications skills, business judgment and work ethic.

title: Director of Market Research and Consumer Insights
summary: The Director of Market Research and Consumer Insights will lead, define, and direct the Voice of Customer work for all of the Herff Jones business units. This leader will deeply understand our marketplace, our customers, and the consumers that use our products as part of their educational experience in elementary and secondary schools. This person will design and execute both qualitative and quantitative research with internal tools and through outside research providers to build organizational insight and knowledge that will shape our product and marketing strategies. This person will work collaboratively with the organization to find answers to key strategic questions and will routinely present findings to leadership. The Director of Market Research & Consumer Insights will be a key voice in shaping, improving, and evolving our suite of products and services based on evolving trends and insights gained in research. The overall goal of the Director of Market Research & Consumer Insights will be to keep the full marketing team well informed on current trends and assure that all we do is well grounded in consumer and industry understanding to enable great decisions that lead to sustained revenue growth for Herff Jones. What we want you to accomplish: What three to five things need accomplished in the first year to determine success? Build, develop, grow, and lead a strong marketing insights function and culture in our organization to inform our product and business decisions. Develop annual research plan and budget based on business plan and key initiatives. Keep the organization informed on how both educators and administrators decide on who to choose as a partner in our business, and how parents decide to purchase, or not purchase our products. Work collaboratively within the organization to assure that our culture, all communications, and all aspects of our product and service offering reflect a deep understanding of our target partner schools and customers. Have the expertise in our organization to find the right data sources to fully and efficiently provide answers to key questions. Core Activities: Consumer, Shopper, and Industry Insight Mining Quantitative and Qualitative Research Leadership Presentation of findings and business implications to all levels of the organization Thought leadership with the ability to engage and influence senior leadership. Success Indicators: 5 years previous success in leading a marketing insights function 10 years of experience in designing and leading consumer, customer, industry research. Deep understanding of consumer data sources and research techniques to include marketing communication research, concept testing and segmentation in both B2B and B2C environments. Analytically driven approach to market analysis including experience in qualitative and quantitative market research, quantitative analysis of product and financial data and competitive intelligence activities Track record for innovation thinking combined with a pragmatic, roll-up-the-sleeves execution and results delivery Excellent communication skills – verbal and written – and strong interpersonal skills Strong people and management skills to interact with customers, staff, colleagues, cross-functional teams, sales and third parties. Willing to travel 20% Education / Certification Required: Bachelor’s degree in Marketing or related relevant field of study Advanced Degree a plus Experience with Qualtrics a plus

title: Director Customer Insights and CRM
summary: This position will drive marketing business intelligence by driving customer insights behind a complete 360 degree view of the customer: who she is, how does she respond to Pier 1 marketing, what does she value in a home decor specialty retailer, and determining opportunities of optimization across our product and customer portfolio. The Director of Customer Insights is responsible for directing the team in generating insights from the customer database and marketplace opportunity population to drive personalization initiatives. This person is responsible for identifying key business challenges, establishing a test and learn cadence in order to be able to accurately solve for recommendations to these challenges, and managing marketing campaigns aimed at tackling customer opportunities for enhanced experience with the brand. This position will establish reporting tools, synthesize data, and direct the creation of actionable dashboarding for executive leadership. They will lead qualitative and quantitative analysis of customers, market trends and competitive landscape to highlight improvements, growth opportunities and new markets. This Director will oversee staff and vendor partners on the development of customer segmentation and value schemes, predictive modeling, campaign management and CRM strategies, and customer-level understanding to shape critical business decisions. Duties & Responsibilities Strategic Customer Insight Development: work cross-functionally with leaders to determine opportunities, develop strategies, and ensure execution of customer analytical projects to provide relevant insights and recommendations for team members across the organization. This person will be front-of-line in identifying opportunities for insights to decipher customer experience issues, identify areas of customer opportunity, and develop relevant campaigns for growth and engagement development at the customer-level. Champion the development of Customer Research and Insight initiatives: This person sits across the Analytics Center of Excellence at Pier 1, and provides input and direction to Pier 1's enterprise data strategy, working closely with IT, Operations, Strategic business units, Real Estate, Ecommerce, Stores, Digital Marketing, and Merchandising to increase access to insights generated from the customer database and improve understanding of the customer across the organization. This person is critical to the management of segmentation modeling and education on the customer and research initiatives organization-wide. Management of team and outside vendors to develop marketing insights, marketing media modeling, customer behavior insight development, and the tracking of key brand health metrics. CRM Segmentation and Lifecycle Development: The Director of Customer Insights and CRM will utilize customer insights and segmentation development to optimize the lifecycle understanding by customer, along with her journey with the Pier 1 Imports brand. This person will work with Brand and Loyalty Marketing to attain the right level of customer retention goals, and ensure channel and customer attrition plans are delivered. This person will engage with and develop against changing market place dynamics and translate them into actionable CRM (direct mail, SMS, email marketing, mobile app) strategies to achieve customer objectives. Talent Development - Manage the department structure, direction and professional development of direct reports. Train, coach, motivate, develop and manage Marketing and Research Analysts towards their personal goals, channel specific KPIs, and department KPIs. Act as a subject matter expert for best practices for campaign reporting, analytics, and marketing research. Provide coaching and leadership to enhance the team's visibility within the organization. Build cross-functional accountability and cross-training to allow the team growth opportunities. Budget Management - Solely responsible for maintaining marketing research budget lines, along with having influence over Database Service budget lines. Education & Experience 5-10 years of retail data and analytics experience required. Knowledge of statistics as they relate to direct marketing, predictive modeling, customer research. Solid quantitative background including proficiency in problem solving, data analysis and modeling. Strong ability to pull business relevancy from data. Deep understanding of CRM principals and concepts. Cross channel data integration supporting both acquisition and retention marketing. Deep knowledge of relational databases. Advanced knowledge and daily use of ETL (extract, transfer, and load data between sources) and SQL Server. Expertise with research methodologies such as usage and attitude studies and research design. History of working with tools that monitor performance of the brand in the marketplace and having the ability to understand information to help develop market strategy. Working knowledge of statistical tools (SAAS, R, etc). Bachelors Degree required with a preferred Graduate Degree/MBA in Marketing Research/Analytics. title: Researcher
summary: Job Code RS0056 Researcher II Humanities Duties & Responsibilities The Vice Provost for Advances in Learning (VPAL) at Harvard University invites applications with exceptional data analytics skills and relevant backgrounds in social science, behavioral science, or educational research to advance higher education through Harvard’s ongoing research on assessing and improving residential, blended, and open digital learning environments.  This position is open for Researcher or Research Scientist levels based on applicants’ qualifications and experience.  The Researcher will work as part of team of staff researchers who support the mission of VPAL at Harvard University. S/he will conduct original data analyses, synthesize and apply relevant extant research, and develop and implement data visualizations aligned with Harvard’s core teaching and learning mission. Researcher will convene with related research groups to share expertise, provide feedback on each other’s efforts, and collaborate on projects of mutual interest. As appropriate, insights gained through this research will be disseminated through a mix of internal reports, in-person presentations, posters, publishable academic manuscripts, and other channels to maximize impact on practice.  Although specific projects will evolve based on the research needs of the University as well as the expertise and interests of the Researcher, specific responsibilities include: Provide analytic and program evaluation support to the research team. Perform complex analytical and programming tasks with limited direction. Identify methodological challenges related to the work and help resolve or elevate these within the research team. Help assemble, clean, and manage data sets derived from multiple sources. Support data visualization, statistical analysis, and program evaluation. Serve as an in-house expert on quantitative methods and their application to evaluation of teaching and learning environments. Present key findings to internal and external audiences. Author and co-author reports, research proposals, issue briefs, and articles for publication. This is one year term appointment, with strong likelihood of renewal, contingent on funding, university and program priorities, and satisfactory job performance. The position will remain open until filled. Basic Qualifications Candidates MUST meet the following basic qualifications in order to be considered for this role:  BA in learning science, education, data science, computer science, sociology, economics, political science, psychology or a related field required. A minimum of three years relevant experience in social science, behavioral science, or educational research.  Additional Qualifications Applicants must have an interest in educational research. Preference for candidates with a MA or Ph.D. in related fields and expertise working with large datasets. Candidates should have training in and experience using quantitative methods, including some combination of methods of non-experimental, quasi-experimental, and experimental program evaluation, assessment, and surveys. Applicant must possess strong writing, presentation, interpersonal, and technical skills, and be willing to work as part of a collaborative, diverse research team.  Demonstrated experience communicating technical topics to non-technical audiences. Experience in university research with attention to teaching and learning environments is preferred. While all employees of the VPAL research team are term appointments, we envision that the staff scientist will play a critical role in supporting a number of expanding research projects and ventures within the VPAL research group.  Additional Information Position is available for immediate appointment. Please attach your cover letter, followed by your resume, as one document. Your cover letter should speak specifically about coursework in and experience using quantitative methods. In addition, please submit a writing sample on which you are the sole or lead author. We regret that Harvard University does not provide visa sponsorship for this position. Please note: this position is posted at grades 56 and 57. There is one open Researcher/Research Scientist position that can be filled at either grade. The grade level will be determined based upon the level of experience and skill set of the successful candidate. title: Senior Manager of Oncology Business Insights & Analytics
summary: The Senior Manager of Oncology Business Insights & Analytics is a dynamic member of BMS’ commercial planning team that partners very closely with Marketing, Finance, Marketing Science, and Market Research teams. He/she will be responsible for working with and managing their support resources to complete the standard BMS Business Insights & Analytics deliverables, as well as delivering high quality solutions and answers to ad hoc requests/questions. The Senior Manager or Senior Manager serves as an internal consultant to senior leadership by providing analytic guidance, and helping brand teams (and extended stakeholders) make informed strategic decisions and choices. This is a unique role within BMS Oncology, and the individual may be responsible for either Forecasting or Chart Audit insights, depending upon the candidate’s background, experience, and interest. The Senior Manager or Senior Manager will help to identify and contextualize critical business issues, and works to embed an objective and unbiased point of view into the business conversation. He/she will need to partner effectively with other functions (Marketing, Marketing Science, Market Research, Managed Care, Finance, Clinical) to identify logical and defendable forecast assumptions and/or Chart Audit insights, and support the strategic decision making process. Additional Responsibilities : Develop short-term range-based forecasts for the assigned therapeutic area, based upon sound assumptions, and present recommendation to stakeholders within the organization. Ex-US forecasting may be required for specific brands. Proactively and continuously assess the relevant marketplace and its dynamics, customers and competitors. Provide an unbiased point of view on the performance of markets/brands, supported by facts and evidence Proactively partner with marketing teams to frame and articulate relevant business issues and develop the appropriate analytics / research design to address them. Develop and execute analytic plans to mine patient- and physician-level data (e.g., chart audit data) in order to generate in-depth understanding and insights of the oncology market, BMS and competitor brands, to provide customer-focused input on strategic and tactical business issues. Lead the synthesis of data generation and insights from multiple sources (primary and secondary) and develops realistic, insightful, and actionable recommendations to inform forecast assumptions but also marketing strategy and tactics. When required, become involved in the design and development of market research forecast studies (i.e. demand research). Provide explanation of variance to forecast, which combines secondary data (IMS/SHS/EMR/Claims/etc) and general business insights. Develop and deliver clear, concise presentations that synthesize disparate data (market research, secondary data, etc.), and that demonstrates a deep understanding of the market dynamics, competition, and brand. Partner with Worldwide and Early Asset teams to perform business case assessments for development decisions and advise lifecycle leaders on significant development decisions and lifecycle plans. Provide context for decisions, both disease area and portfolio context, to help teams understand how decisions will be perceived by senior management / late-stage portfolio committee. Develop and implement market research & analytical plans, in collaboration with cross-functional teams. Oversee all analytics operations to correct discrepancies and ensure quality; manage, direct, and mentor junior staff. Requirements: BA required, Masters or PhD preferred 3+ years of Biotech or Pharma experience in any of the aforementioned analytics areas Ability to influence senior leaders on critical decisions Extensive knowledge and use of both primary research and secondary data Strong grasp of an individual analytical discipline, such as forecasting, market research, or marketing science, with a good general knowledge of the others Detailed understanding and mastery of patient level data (e.g., EMR, chart audits, claims, etc), and ability to work closely with agencies and partners to ensure high quality deliverables. Ability to connect analytics with the overarching business questions, and can understand the link between brand strategy and analytic insights Manage ambiguity by questioning data and/or stakeholder for further nuanced information. Ability to operate on less than perfect data, by having a sound logical framework. Can develop new ways of thinking about a problem, in order to provide an effective solution Can defend a position when necessary, particularly around forecast assumptions, and is persuasive in negotiations (especially as it relates to senior / executive management) Knowledgeable of managed care, and how it may affect a brand forecast Demonstrates a continuous commitment to the QC process to ensure quality of deliverables meets or exceeds team’s standards Experience conducting or managing primary market research and/or developing and using Excel-based forecast models and Spotfire is also a plus Experience in oncology is preferred

Build and maintain assessments across the LMS.  Ensure timely and accurate audience management through the provisioning manager. title: Campaign Effectiveness Analyst, Google BrandLab
summary: BrandLab provides Google’s top partners with an accelerator program that delivers data-driven solutions to solve their critical brand campaign challenges and advance their digital video strategies. This team provides breakthrough creative effectiveness, using a collaborative experimentation approach that uncovers innovative creative approaches for video ads grounded in data.   You will provide the analytical abilities for both teams, in their shared mission to drive excellence in digital video strategy and execution for our top advertising partners. The team’s programs and experiments are focussed on developing hypotheses, custom creative and/or media recommendations, and testing these via rapid and innovative tests. Given clients invest a significant amount of time (and often media budget) during these engagements they have high expectations about what we deliver.   As a thought leader in shaping creative and campaign effectiveness research, you will take the lead on analyzing and researching creative and campaign effectiveness reporting into the Head of Innovation for BrandLab.   Your work will involve designing and executing multiple research studies to test the impact of various creative and media factors (i.e. creative comparisons, multi-asset x multi-cell, creative sequencing). It will require you to leverage Google’s data, research and measurement solutions, and 3rd party data and analysis techniques to develop innovative methodologies to uncover new outcomes.   You are comfortable extracting and manipulating data as this role will require you to regularly pull and analyze data (i.e. correlate/triangulate data sets) to identify learnings and insights. You will need to be comfortable with learning about new data sets, and shaping the data to be accessible for the team (i.e. dashboards). and present internally/externally.   You have an entrepreneurial spirit, and the ability to build structured processes and methodologies from the ground up. It will require you to comfortably navigate other global/regional teams who are working on creative/media effectiveness to unlock new opportunities and share learnings.   Global Solutions is the link between Google products and business. Your focus is to help turn innovation into complete, packaged tools that allow our customers to get the most that they need from our suite of products. As part of the Global Solutions team, you'll help to ensure that Google has adopted the right strategy for our products. Working in one of three specialized areas – Performance, Brand, or Publisher & Platform – you'll use your expertise to help front-line Sales partners to work their magic quickly and effectively. Above all, you are passionate about all things digital, and want to help shape the ever-changing world of online advertising.   Responsibilities Design new measurement methodologies/solutions to test creative experiments by leveraging Google and/or 3rd party solutions Analyze results from creative effectiveness research, combined with additional Google data where relevant, to provide learnings to inform clients creative and media strategies and executions Extract data to develop creative effectiveness meta-learnings across critical industry verticals (Automotive, Food/Beverage, Home/Personal Care, Pharma and Technology.) Partner closely with Brandlab and Unskippable Experiments team to ensure all client/team research deliverables are completed on time Lead efforts to hack/combine Google's measurement tools (Datalogix, YouTube Analytics, Brand Lift, Search Lift, GCS etc.) to develop sharper creative effectiveness methodologies that provide deeper learnings  Qualifications Minimum qualifications: Bachelor's degree in an analytical subject area or equivalent practical experience. Experience in SQL to extract raw data from tables with experience building dashboards and automating analyses. Experience with creative measurement tools (e.g. MMM, Nielsen NetEffect, Nielsen Catalina, Ipsos Connect etc.) with experience on how to use these tools to extract creative learnings and in-market impact.  Preferred qualifications: 5 years of relevant analytical, insights and media measurement work experience. Experience in testing creative and/or media strategies for clients or your own brand. Experience presenting to senior-level clients and know how to capture their attention and expand their thinking. Strong understanding of the factors that are driving the rapid evolution of the digital landscape (Mobile, Programmatic, Measurement etc) for brand marketers. Proven analytic capabilities around business and brand campaign challenges and opportunities, with the ability to make strategic. recommendations to strengthen their digital video strategies. Proven track record in high productivity environments and an ability to work efficiently and manage multiple projects and stakeholders at the same time. Proven ability to work cooperatively and proactively with teams inside and outside Google. Ability to speak marketer’s language and present data in a compelling way, and make complex data sets/concepts simple to understand.

company: Center For Strategic And International Studies
title: Program Coordinator/Research Assistant- Americas Program
summary: The Center for Strategic and International Studies (CSIS) is a non-profit, bipartisan public policy organization established in 1962 to provide strategic insights and practical policy solutions to decision-makers concerned with global security and prosperity. Over the years, it has grown to be one of the largest organizations of its kind, with a staff of some 200 employees, including more than 120 analysts. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Functions may include, but are not limited to the following: Assist with managing all strategic and functional program operations, including assisting with crafting research agendas, maintaining timelines, and linking program initiatives with program priorities.  Assist with the fiscal management of the program, including proposal development, budget creation and expense tracking, preparation for quarterly financial reviews, and reporting to funders.  Plan and manage program meetings, briefings, and conferences, hosting high-level officials from the U.S. government and other governments, business leaders, and others.  Administer the internship program, including recruitment, application review and selection, and support in the management.  Draft program correspondence, Memorandums of Understanding (MOUs), and other agreements.  Support senior program staff, including through logistics, scheduling, and program communication and collaboration with other CSIS departments and operations.  Assist with managing day-to-day office operations.  KNOWLEDGE, EDUCATION, AND EXPERIENCE: Undergraduate degree in Latin American Studies, Political Science, International Relations, Public Policy, or other relevant field.  Demonstrated interest or experience in the Western Hemisphere.  Proficiency in managing complex budget activities.  Ability to manage competing priorities and multiple projects under tight deadlines.  Strong preference for candidate with Spanish language skills. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential job functions. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.
