title: Director, Customer Insights and Solutions
summary: Your Responsibilities :  This role will directly contribute to a key company goal of ensuring patients have appropriate access to GSK products. In this job you will be expected to align USMA’s research, communication and medical engagement plans with US population-decision-maker needs which is critical to establishing and maintaining access to our medicines. YOUR KEY RESPONSIBIITIES:  • Play a critical role in that alignment process by leveraging your understanding of customer needs to drive US medical strategies and priorities across multiple brands in a therapeutic area  • Determine how, and through what channels, USMA will translate and communicate evidence on GSK products to US Payers, IDNs, policymakers and other formulary decision-makers.  • Generate and communicate evidence that meets customer’s needs and informs access decisions on GSK products  • Plan and deliver relevant and meaningful customer communication materials for our HOL/HPL to emerging and anticipated PBDM evidence needs  • Serve as the internal liaison between the field medical teams and internal medical and commercial matrix teams to communicate PBDM needs  • Lead the development of strategic engagement and communication plans for multiple brands and across multiple customer segments (Payers, IDNs, Policy Makers, etc)  • Develop and lead launch excellence plans for USHO & MP Field Team  • Identify and/or anticipate PBDM needs in context of brand access strategies, emerging data, or new market entrants  • Translate real-world evidence, CER, and other observational research studies (including models) in a compelling and effective manner  • Partner with Medical Information to ensure PBDM medical content is relevant to needs of the customer  • Serve as the primary internal advocate for PBDM (payer and policymakers) customers  • Support HOL and HOL activities to align with PBDM customer needs and brand strategies  • Develop new and innovative ways to meet established and emerging PBDM customer needs, which may include facilitating development of medical content on above brand health policy/economic topics  • Understand and assess the impact of changing market dynamics, unanticipated customer barriers, or evolving customer needs  • Develop a set of potential solutions that align with customer needs, product strategy and GSK compliance requirements  • Anticipate and make plans to address problems and barriers in the context of a highly matrixed and regulated environment  • Assess risk associated with proposed medical activities/communications/customer materials  • Work within a highly-matrixed and dynamic internal team environment  • Maintain a command of a large amount of scientific information across multiple therapeutic areas and show effective written/verbal communication skills  • Develop and maintain strong trusted relationships with internal partners  • Establish rapport, trust and credibility with individuals in highly-influential roles within US Medical Affairs or Commercial teams  • Inform, influence, and engage Director-level and higher commercial and medical business partners  • Collect feedback and insights from the HOLs and HPLs and lead cross functional groups in brainstorming and problem-solving sessions  • Communicate, present, review and apply consensus and/or syndicated reports, research plans, Medical Voice of Customer analytics, etc.   Why You?   BECAUSE, You:  • Hold a Pharm D, PhD, M.P.H., M.S. degree or have equivalent education  • Have previous work experience in Health Outcomes, Pharmacoeconomics, Epidemiology, Health Policy/Health Services Research, Pharmacy, Public Health, or Health Administration  • Have relevant scientific or health policy experience (communicating and translating population-based research) in a pharmaceutical, managed care, or Health System setting  • Have understanding of observational research methodologies and a demonstrated ability to translate real world evidence (RWE), comparative effectiveness research (CER) and other observational research studies (including economic models) in an effective and credible manner  • Have proven experience influencing internal research teams and communicating population-based decision makers (PBDM) (payers and policymakers) priorities and needs  • Have demonstrated experience leading cross functional matrix teams to facilitate the development of content to respond to requests of PBDMs on health outcomes, economic and policy-related topics.  • Have experience communicating and translating evidence and customer insights to/with matrix team partners  • Have proven ability to develop innovative, customer-focused medical solutions and resources  • Have proven your ability to leverage technology and multiple communication channels for customer engagement  • Have the ability to work autonomously, proactively and independently  • Have proven communication and strategic skills  • Have demonstrated your ability to identify opportunities for medical engagement and develop strategic customer engagement and communication plans for payers and policymakers  • Have proven experience working with third party vendors and managing projects/budgets  • Have experience operating in a highly dynamic, changing environment  • Possess an understanding of the US healthcare environment with respect to US Payer, IDN and Policy Maker needs, priorities and evidence requirements  • Understand how population-based decision makers are using evidence to inform policy decisions, how they are defining the value of new interventions, and how they are managing utilization within their populations.   Preferred qualifications:  • Experience with and knowledge of US Payers, Integrated Delivery Networks (IDNs)s, or US Policymakers (ICER, CMS, AHRQ, etc)  • Residency and/or post-doctoral training in health outcomes or health policy  • Experience with and knowledge of US Payers, IDNs, or Government Customers (CMS, AHRQ, etc)  • Residency and/or post-doctoral training in a pharmaceutical industry/health system/payer setting  • Experience influencing internal research teams and communicating PBDM priorities and needs  • Experience communicating and translating evidence and customer insights to/with matrix team partners; proven ability to develop innovative, customer-focused medical solutions and resources.  • Understand Medical Health Information Technology/EMR platforms, systems, and observational databases  • Ability to leverage technology and multiple communication channels for customer engagement  • Ability work autonomously, proactively and independently; proven ability to work across and influence a commercial and medical matrix team  • Ability to identify opportunities for medical engagement and develop strategic customer engagement and communication plans for a brand or within a customer segment  • Understand observational research methodologies  • Ability to translate real-world evidence, CER, and other observational research studies (including models) in an effective credible manner  • Ability to independently evaluate the scientific literature regarding observational research and health economics and health policy  • Experience operating in a highly dynamic, changing environment   Why GSK? :  At GSK, our mission is to improve the quality of human life by enabling people to do more, feel better and live longer. title: Marketing Analytics Manager
summary: About Us: HomeAway, based in Austin, Texas, is the world leader in vacation rentals with more than 2 million unique places to stay in 190 countries, and is a part of the Expedia, Inc. family of brands. HomeAway offers an extensive selection of vacation rental homes that provide travelers with memorable experiences and benefits, especially more room to relax, for less than the cost of traditional hotel accommodations. The company also makes it easy for vacation rental owners and property managers to advertise their properties and manage bookings online.  The Opportunity: Manager, Growth Marketing Analytics and Data Insights At HomeAway.com, we're committed to helping families and friends find the perfect vacation rental through our online marketplace to create unforgettable travel experiences together. We are part of Expedia Inc. and our mission is to revolutionize travel through the power of technology. HomeAway has the energy of a start-up, plus the stability of being part of the largest travel company in the world! Once you are part of the family, the career opportunities are endless.  Experience: The HomeAway Analytics and Data Insights team is looking for a proactive, analytical and technically-skilled leader to join our team. This position will be responsible for leading an analytics team of 4-8analysts supporting a sophisticated global growth marketing team, covering SEM, programmatic display and affiliate marketing and multiple related product andengineering teams. We’re looking for an experienced leader who will be a thought leader on using advanced data analytics to develop insights that can materially improve our marketing investment decisions. This role reports to the head of the global Marketing Analytics team and requires an individual with excellent statistical and analytical abilities and experience leading an analytical team. The successful candidate will be a key partner tithe growth marketing and product leaders and will use his/her outstanding business acumen to align on priorities and consult on key decisions, especially in performance marketing. Demonstrated experience leading complex data projects including building self-service reporting products, automating experimentation analyses or building sophisticated marketing attribution models is a plus.  What You’ll Do: Lead a team of analysts in providing recommendations to the growth marketing and product teams on how to improve and drive marketing performance. Improve our ability to synthesize and extract insights from large volumes of data, focusing on marketing attribution models and lifetime value calculations. Identify and scope new A/B/multivariate testing opportunities in Marketing and Product to advance our measurement of these tests using Bayesian methodology. Partner with the Technology and Engineering teams in an Agile model to implement self-service data products that will allow teams to access accurate information directly and easily. Directly manage a team of 4-8 professionals, ensuring we have training and career development plans that will set them up for success today and going forward. Partner with key stakeholders to prioritize asks based on highest potential value added, and proactively drive initiatives from there. Leverage strategic marketing partnerships with Google and other publishers to derive marketing insights.  What You’ll Bring: Bachelor degree in an analytical field (e.g., Strategy, Business, Economics, Mathematics, Statistics) and 7+ years of experience in data analytics OR Master’s degree in an analytical field (e.g. Strategy, Business, Economics, Mathematics, Statistics) and 4+ years of experience. 4+ years’ experience managing teams, prioritizing and delegating work and leading multiple complex projects concurrently. Past experience operating in Scrum/agile methodology preferred. Proven track record of solving complex business problems and communicating easily understood recommendations to teams for implementation. High technical aptitude, experience with SQL, SAS, R (or similar tools). Strong working knowledge of marketing metrics, attribution models, and advanced experimentation (Doubleclick stackpreferred, Adwords, VisualIQ) preferred. Excellent presentation, written, and verbal communication skills. Flexible and enthusiastic and ability to deliver results in a constantly-evolving environment. Passion for data-driven business decision making and ability to thrive in a large matrixed organization. Background in consulting or relevant area – travel, real estate preferred. Familiarity with eCommerce, web analytics and big data and visualization platforms (Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, Tableau, Looker, BigQuery) preferred.  Benefits & Perks: Competitive health and insurance benefits. Competitive salary. Annual target bonus or commission. Paid vacation and sick time. Vacation rental on a yearly basis (taxable benefit). Employee Stock Purchase Program. Free snacks and beverages. Frequent company update talks with our leadership team. Free listing on HomeAway.com. Electronic, adjustable stand-up desk. Discounted Metro & Rail pass. Casual dress. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

title: Customer Insights Lead
summary: Nest is looking for a ridiculously talented and business-minded candidate to drive our customer insight efforts across the company. This role is central to the company’s product, marketing, and sales efforts.  The ideal candidate isn’t afraid to get their hands dirty to get the job done, but can also influence and drive change across the business. The work: Lead a broad set of research efforts including surveys, analysis of secondary data, and qualitative methods to gain a deep understanding of the people who will buy and use our products Drive decisions related to customer experience, feature set, messaging, go to market strategy, and geographic and category expansion Broadly champion a customer-centric philosophy across the company  Minimum qualifications: 4+ years in primary marketing research and/or consumer insights Bachelor's degree in business, marketing, social science, or statistics  Preferred qualifications: Master's degree in business, marketing, social science, or statistics Hands-on experience conducting quantitative and qualitative marketing research projects from start to finish, including design, fielding, analysis, and reporting Deep understanding of consumer behavior (e.g., behavioral economics, consumer journey mapping, consumer decision making models, etc.) Mastery of inferential and descriptive statistics and proficient in statistical analysis software like SPSS, SAS, R, etc. Strong ability to visualize complex data and ideas and in concise and compelling ways using tools like Google Slides, Powerpoint, Tableau, Illustrator, etc. Experience in the tech, retail, energy, or security industry Experience moderating focus groups, IDIs, shop alongs, etc. Experience programming surveys in Qualtrics, Optimal Workshop, Sawtooth, etc. Experience conducting global research studies in multiple languages Experience using insights to develop strategies that maximize value to both the company and customers Ability to conduct research using advanced analytical techniques like TURF, conjoint, factor analysis, clustering, key driver analysis Advanced SPSS, R, Tableau, and/or SQL skills Willingness to own all stages of the analysis process Strong communicator - both written and verbal

title: Market Analyst (Contract)
summary: About the role Zillow is looking for Market Analysts to help improve how we value real estate across the country. You will be in charge of quickly and accurately valuing homes using data on the property and neighborhood, recent similar home sales, and insights from Zillow’s unique algorithms and data like the Zestimate. This information will help buyers, seller, and investors make more informed decisions. We are always looking for ways to improve, so you will be expected to help identify and recommend additional tools and data that would help make our valuations even more accurate, and stay on top of local market trends. About the team: You will join a team at Zillow tackling problems at the core of the evolution of Zillow’s mission to empower the consumer and transform the real estate industry, by helping buyers and sellers and creating a better real estate experience for all. In particular this quickly growing team is trying to improve the selling experience by giving homeowners a more accurate picture of the value of their home and help them sell quickly, easily and for a fair price. Who you are: Extremely analytical and detail oriented Excellent verbal and written communication skills Experience with residential real estate and real estate valuation a plus Degree in a quantitative field a plus Get to know us  Zillow Group houses a portfolio of the largest and most vibrant real estate and home-related brands on the web and mobile. Zillow Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative environment with the best employees. title: Senior Research Investigator
summary: We are seeking a highly motivated bioinformatician with academic and/or industry experience to join our Integrated Translational Bioinformatics team with a focus on Cardiovascular/Fibrosis/Immunology team. This bioinformatics group has a systems biology mandate to perform pathway, network and other meta-analysis of the relevant collection of internal and external omic data. The overriding goal is to address defined translational questions of fundamental importance to the fields of heart failure, fibrosis and immunological diseases such as defining patient populations, surrogate markers, drug repositioning and defining effective drug combinations in order to generate actionable scientific insights, hypotheses, and recommendations for stakeholders across the enterprise. The candidate is expected to be able to integrate multi-omic data from preclinical data or clinical trials as well as literature-based evidence to understand disease pathogenesis Responsibilities · Analysis of various omic-scale data including RNA-Seq, Exome and Whole Genome Sequencing, single cell sequencing, and high throughput proteomics or metabolomics in order to nominate novel drug targets, enhance mode-of-action understanding, enable patient enrichment strategies and prioritize combination therapies. · Integration and mining of public data sets to further enhance our understanding of the factors influencing disease development. · Evaluate and analyze exploratory omics data from clinical trials to understand drug mechanisms, patient response and develop translational biomarkers. · Extract insights and generate hypotheses to be evaluated in future trials and discovery experiments to inform our clinical strategies and discovery pipeline. · Collaborate with bioinformaticians, statisticians, biologists, and clinicians to identify critical questions that can be addressed via computational approaches. · Design, lead, and manage complex computational research projects. · Help define our bioinformatics strategy to derive actionable knowledge by combing data and analysis over the whole portfolio of existing public and BMS proprietary omics data. Qualifications: · Ph.D. in bioinformatics, engineering, statistics, physics, molecular biology, genetics, or a similar discipline with 5 years of industry or academic experience. · Proven track record designing, leading, and managing complex computational research projects. · Experience working in complex, matrixed organizations expected; experience leading projects in a matrixed environment preferred. · Strong background in omic (RNA, DNA, epigenetic, proteomic) data analysis and biological interpretation. · Solid background in at least one biology area including fibrosis, heart failure and immunology. · The ability to work across organizations to define and solve problems that will benefit the whole. Capable of establishing strong working relationships across the organization. · Ability to communicate effectively with biologists, biostatisticians and computational scientists. · Proficiency using R and Bioconductor packages, at least one scripting language (e.g. Python, Perl), and database experience. · Experience working within a Linux high performance compute clusters and/or cloud-based computing platforms (Amazon EC2). · Working knowledge of publicly available biological databases including NCBI, Ensembl, dbGAP, GEO, SRA, etc. · Experience working with clinical trial data is a plus. · Strong verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to analyze and present data in a clear professional format to computational, bench, and clinical scientists. · Experience working with thought leaders and leading scientific collaborations is essential. Bristol-Myers Squibb is an equal opportunity employer - Minorities/Females/Protected Veterans/Disabled

title: HR Analyst, Employee Relations and Investigations
summary: Google's known for our innovative technologies, products and services -- and for the people behind them. Whether you are making our staffing systems more efficient, planning for our growth, building relationships on college campuses or cultivating the next generation of computer scientists, you have an eye on the staffing needs of Google and the broader hiring landscape. You are focused on cultivating outstanding candidates for Google's long-term hiring needs, and work across a cross-functional and international group of staffing teams. You are both scrappy and resourceful, creative and driven -- and excited to share the magic of working at Google.   As a HR Analyst, you enable the Employee Relations (ER) team to deliver solutions to clients seamlessly. The main priority of the role is to provide support to the ER team and to plan and keep track of delivery across the team and clients. You'll work closely with People Partners and Consultants and liaise with other functions and stakeholders across Google.   In this role, you will work in conjunction with the Employee Relations and Investigations team, other Human Resource Business Partners and Consultants, Integrity and Governance, Ethics and Compliance, Security, Internal Audit and Employment Legal on executing against established processes and refining them to make them more efficient. You will play an important role in helping our global ER team address the data and analytical needs of their teams and clients across the globe.   Great just isn't good enough for our People Operations team (you probably know us better as "Human Resources"). Made up of equal parts HR professionals, former consultants and analysts, we're the champions of Google's colorful culture. In People Ops, we "find them, grow them, and keep them" - we bring the world's most innovative people to Google and provide the programs that help them thrive. Whether recruiting the next great Googler, refining our core programs, developing talent or simply looking for ways to inject some more fun into the lives of our Googlers, we bring a data-driven approach that is reinventing the human resources field.   Responsibilities Use analytical reasoning to identify problems and develop hypotheses, often recommending a data product that addresses client’s/stakeholder’s needs. Assist with maintenance and update of investigations database and documentation. Provide management coordination and guidance for HR Business Partners and Managers on reorganizations. Maintain and update reorg documentation, reorg site and tracking tools, primarily responsible for reorg paperwork and tracking process improvements. Prepare, track and maintain appropriate investigation and reorganization data and documentation. Manipulate and analyze large data sets to distill insights from data and connect disparate ideas into cohesive, well-grounded recommendations using creative, structured and analytical thinking. Architect, develop and automate data and analytics solutions, iteratively build and prototype dashboards to provide insights at scale. Build relationships and collaborate with teammates and HR clients to solve organizational problems and empower organizations with high quality data.  Qualifications Minimum qualifications: BA/BS degree in Economics, Statistics, Finance, Social Science, Psychology, or related field (i.e. Mathematics, Engineering), or equivalent practical experience. 2 years of HR or other relevant experience. Experience working with SQL, Python or other data/scripting language. Experience building and maintaining solutions to collect, store, and organize data to address client needs. Ability to speak and write in English fluently and idiomatically.  Preferred qualifications: Experience turning raw data into meaningful metrics, recommendations for improvements, and action. Experience using quantitative and qualitative analytical strategies and working with multiple data sources to generate insights from analyses, answer questions or create solutions. Experience collaborating on projects involving multiple teams, managing an ongoing relationship with client, and presenting to audiences. Experience using data visualization (e.g. tables, charts, graphs). Experience with conducting research using basic statistics (e.g. correlations, t-tests, regressions). Experience forming testable statements generated from inductive reasoning that can be verified via statistical and analytical means. Project management skills and high attention to detail. Demonstrated ability to operate with confidentiality and commitment to produce high quality work.

title: Analytics Manager - R&D

B.S. degree in a scientific or data-related discipline  - 5+ years of experience working in chemistry/chemical engineering or similar environment  - 2+ years of experience as a data scientist or related   WE VALUE  -Advanced knowledge of analytical approaches, including machine learning, statistical analysis, predictive modeling, visual analytics, and providing end-to-end data visualizations/analytics solutions  -Advanced knowledge of data analytics and visualization tools (e.g. QlikView, Tableau, etc.)  -Excellent communication skills and internal consulting capabilities, with proficiency managing projects across various stakeholder and contributor groups  -Strong understanding of SQL, relational databases, and data modeling experience  -Advanced hands-on scripting experience in PERL, Python or similar  -Experience with HTML, CSS, and Javascript and related web based tools  -Degree in chemistry or chemical engineering strongly preferred  -Industry experience preferred  -Experience analyzing data from traditional R&D data sources (experimental records, LIMS, etc) is preferred  -Experience with Hadoop or similar platforms and related “big data” technologies is preferred  -Experience working in Cloud Computing environments is preferred   Exempt Performance Materials and Technologies INCLUDES Continued Professional Development ADDITIONAL INFORMATION Job ID: req132231 Category: Technology R&D Location: 50 E Algonquin Rd, Des Plaines, IL 60017-5016 USA Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. title: Consumer Insights Manager
summary: At YETI, we believe that time spent outdoors matters more than ever and our gear can make that time extraordinary. When you work here, you have the opportunity to create something exceptional, build something sustainable and make a real impact. We are built for the wild.  As our Consumer Insights Manager, your role will be to gather and communicate consumer insights to business leadership, category management and new product development functions to help identify and illuminate unmet needs and define products that resonate with YETI users. Your list of responsibilities will range from strategic, quantitative surveys to observation and qualitative interviewing in the field. Broad user-based research experience and effective communication will be key. You’ll use data-driven storytelling to help us develop a richer understanding of consumers and drive organizational alignment around market opportunities. Your ability to synthesize and effectively present complex ideas plus your deep understanding of the product development process will help shape our product roadmap. The ideal candidate will have the ability to manage a variety of research projects and/or partners concurrently, inspire others and deliver actionable insights that lead to more badass YETI products.  A look at your day-to-day   Plan research methodologies and budget to maximize the impact and applicability of insights Manage and conduct both qualitative and quantitative research for product development and marketing teams utilizing internal resources as well as external vendors Work with designers and development teams to test product appeal, usability and performance Work independently to plan, facilitate, analyze and present research insights Moderate interviews, brainstorms and discussions with stakeholders to generate new ideas and identify research needs Conduct secondary research to inform research strategies and protocol development Present research findings in a confident, compelling and memorable way; sharing stores, creating graphics and editing video Manage ongoing brand and user benchmark research including NPS, awareness, etc. Employ research best practices and stay abreast of new methods  Now for a little bit about you….   Bachelor’s degree in a research-related field; Design or Marketing Research, Psychology, Sociology, Anthropology, Human Factors or other applicable research field 5+ years of experience in a research role Experience conducting usability testing, protocol and research tool development Experience with Adobe suite or other visualization tools Quantitative skills in survey writing, analysis and proficiency in Excel, SPSS or other data analysis software Strong written, verbal and visual communication skills Proven ability to effectively work within a team and collaborate with others Hands on experience in the design and execution of qualitative and quantitative studies A curiosity and passion to learn  Perks At YETI? title: Analytics Manager
summary: Do you want to broaden your leadership capabilities by working for a leading consulting firm that drives eminence in the marketplace? Are you interested in leveraging your analytical skills and strategic ideas to improve mission execution? If so, Deloitte could be the place for you! Our Federal Strategy and Operations teams bring deep industry expertise, rigorous analytical capabilities and a pragmatic mindset to help solve our client’s most complex business problems. Join our team, and play a key role in helping to design our clients’ roadmap to the future and help transform the Federal marketplace.   Work you’ll Do   As a Manager within our Analytics team, you will:  Organize and deliver services on a cross-section of complex projects  Actively participate in the development of business and vendor relationships  Drive the conceptual and detailed design of enterprise scale analytics capabilities  Participate and lead aspects of the proposal development process  Responsible for project(s) financials including development of financial plans  Manages day-to-day interactions with clients and internal Deloitte team  Displays both breadth and depth of knowledge regarding functional and technical issues  Displays leadership and business judgment in anticipating client/project needs and developing alternative solutions  Provide counseling/coaching, oversight, and support for delivery teams and staff  Actively participate in staff recruitment and retention activities providing input and guidance into the staffing process  Focus on managed revenue targets as well as achieving quarterly or yearly sales objectives for new business  Lead business development initiatives to grow the Analytics team and the Federal practice  Manage resources and budget on client projects  The Team  Transparency, innovation, collaboration, sustainability: these are the hallmark issues shaping Federal government initiatives today. Deloitte’s Federal practice is passionate about making an impact with lasting change. Carrying out missions in the Federal practice requires fresh thinking and a creative approach. We collaborate with teams from across our organization in order to bring the full breadth of Deloitte, its commercial and public sector expertise, to best support our clients. Our aspiration is to be the premier integrated solutions provider in helping to transform the Federal marketplace.  By offering client-tailored services and deep industry insight, the Business Model Transformation team helps clients to seize new growth opportunities, maximize operational effectiveness, elevate their quality of service delivery, and stay ahead of customer demand. Consider a career where you’ll thrive on helping Federal clients to execute on their strategic visions and improve mission performance.   Qualifications   Required:  Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or other business-related field  6+ years of relevant consulting or industry experience  2+ years in a technical or functional lead role  Experience mentoring and coaching others  Proven leadership skills demonstrating strong judgment, problem-solving, and decision-making abilities  Experience managing senior-level client relationships  Experience presenting to clients or other decision makers to present and sell ideas to various audiences (technical and non-technical)  Pre-sales, proposal, and RFP experience  TS/SCI Clearance is required  Preferred:  Individual will be responsible for quantitative analysis of structured, semi-structured, and unstructured data to assess contextual and spatial/temporal relationships in the data.  Individual will work on small teams to conceptualize, design, develop, test, and harden for deployment advanced analytics, e.g. algorithms in Python, R, VBA, Excel, and other tools as required by the client’s problem and environment.  Will likely contribute to the design and development of visualizations and other decision products tailored to the advanced analytics and the client’s decision problem; will be required to both perform analytics and communicate analytic findings and outputs.  Qualified candidates must have a strong orientation to quantitative, data-driven analysis including some of the following skills: • Microsoft Excel – expert proficiency as demonstrated by advanced use of array and nested formulas and strong pivot table use; VBA is a plus but not required   • Demonstrated understanding of statistics; experience with stats packages such as SPSS, STATA, SAS, or MATLAB is a plus   • Programming languages: Python, R, VBA, SQL, C++   • Geographic Information Systems (GIS): ArcGIS, QGIS   • Data Visualization: Tableau; Qlikview; D3, Spotfire, Oracle BI, Cognos BI   • Experience working in a cloud based environment, such as the Google Cloud Platform (GCP), or the Amazon Cloud and using languages such as Jupyter and TensorFlow   How you’ll grow  At Deloitte, our professional development plan focuses on helping people at every level of their career to identify and use their strengths to do their best work every day. From entry-level employees to senior leaders, we believe there’s always room to learn. We offer opportunities to help sharpen skills in addition to hands-on experience in the global, fast-changing business world. From on-the-job learning experiences to formal development programs at Deloitte University, our professionals have a variety of opportunities to continue to grow throughout their career. Explore Deloitte University, The Leadership Center.   Benefits  At Deloitte, we know that great people make a great organization. We value our people and offer employees a broad range of benefits. Learn more about what working at Deloitte can mean for you.   Deloitte’s culture  Our positive and supportive culture encourages our people to do their best work every day. We celebrate individuals by recognizing their uniqueness and offering them the flexibility to make daily choices that can help them to be healthy, centered, confident, and aware. We offer well-being programs and are continuously looking for new ways to maintain a culture where our people excel and lead healthy, happy lives. Learn more about Life at Deloitte.   Corporate citizenship  Deloitte is led by a purpose: to make an impact that matters. This purpose defines who we are and extends to relationships with our clients, our people and our communities. We believe that business has the power to inspire and transform. We focus on education, giving, skill-based volunteerism, and leadership to help drive positive social impact in our communities. Learn more about Deloitte’s impact on the world.   Recruiter tips  We want job seekers exploring opportunities at Deloitte to feel prepared and confident. To help you with your interview, we suggest that you do your research: know some background about the organization and the business area you’re applying to. Check out recruiting tips from Deloitte professionals.   #LI: PTY

title: Analytics and Media Manager
summary: The Amazon Media Group (AMG) operates at the intersection of Advertising and eCommerce and offers advertisers a rich array of innovative advertising solutions across Amazon’s mobile and desktop websites, proprietary devices and the Amazon Advertising Platform. We believe that advertising, when done well, can greatly enhance the value of the customer experience and generate a positive return on investment for our advertising partners.  Analytics and Media Managers are key members of the AMG account team, and their strategic and consultative digital expertise is considered critical to delivering the best return on investment for our customers. AMG is currently looking for a highly motivated Analytics and Media Manager to help scale our growing media business by working with sales, operations, product, retail, and other Amazon business partners to analyze and improve a brand’s performance on Amazon, specifically as it relates to their marketing initiatives.  In this position you will play a pivotal role with our largest and most complex accounts, working with an account team to drive growth across advertiser KPIs. You will act as a strategic analytical partner for advertisers, participating in upfront strategy and negotiations, influencing retail and search marketing initiatives and owning account-level strategic conversations internally and externally. You will exhibit deep analytical ability, and you will develop great expertise in Amazon’s proprietary metrics, working to constantly evolve how we analyze and communicate data to our advertisers. You will tie all facets of a client’s business together to provide clear direction and guidance to C-level marketing leaders, using experimentation, quarterly business reviews, and frequent in-person client sessions to regularly iterate on and articulate a brand’s story.  As the Analytics and Media Manager you will be expected to demonstrate behavior that exemplifies the Amazon leadership principles and to drive innovation and roadmap decisions that increase the ease and availability of data to both internal teams and external partners.   Basic Qualifications Bachelor's degree plus 5+ years’ experience in client-facing data analysis roles Extremely curious with passion for discovering the underlying drivers of consumer behavior Ability to aggregate and analyze internal and external metrics to assess performance drivers and identify actionable insights and leverage these to influence decision making Highly proficient with Microsoft Excel Excellent organizational, interpersonal, and communication (written and verbal) skills Ability to work cross-functionally and with others with diverse skill sets  Preferred Qualifications · Familiarity with SQL  · Fluency with advanced analytical and visualization tools such as Tableau  · Experience with SalesForce  · Digital media planning experience  · MBA or Master’s degree in Economics, Marketing, Statistics, Advertising, or Business

title: Marketing Planner
summary: Apple’s Retail Marketing team is seeking a Planner to help develop our global retail marketing strategy, influencing innovation and thought leadership across core marketing initiatives for seasonal campaigns and product launches in store and online. Key Qualifications 7 - 10 years experience developing and presenting custom plans and solutions for global brands within an advertising / digital agency and client-side organization across channels, including digital, print, outdoor, and social. Understand business challenges and lead strategically to formulate effective marketing plans that support business goals and improve business results. Work closely with creative organizations to lead successful hand off of strategic plans through creative development, execution, and learnings. Think creatively to address challenges and opportunities. Maintain a thorough understanding of emerging marketing trends and methods, and integrate these practices into plans to maximize effectiveness. Ability to successfully pitch strategic plans to senior leadership. Be able to explain the strategy, planning function and value of marketing initiatives to non-marketing audiences, both in person and in writing. Superior written and verbal communication, interpersonal, and organizational skills, to handle multiple projects simultaneously under tight deadlines. Demonstrated ability to grow internal and stakeholder relationships across a wide range of teams to plan and drive business goals. Experience working with international peers to define global marketing strategies for the businesses you support. The ability to translate goals into actionable and measurable plans and communicate these results to leaders. Proven record of evaluating marketing campaigns and programs from multiple data sources, and drawing clear conclusions and actionable recommendations. Develop success metrics and share results (qualitative and quantitive) with the Retail Marketing team, stakeholders and leaders. Description As a strategist, you live and breathe planning. You are dynamic, results-driven and enjoy a high-change environment that is constantly evolving. Knowing every communication and every touchpoint has a goal, you synthesize large amounts of information into key insights that are consumer and behavioral truths. When you’re on point, your plans provide our partners with clarity, leaving no ambiguity about objective. And when inspiration isn’t there, you have the drive and initiative to think creatively to identify potential opportunities for growth and improvement. You are exceptionally savvy and have the skills to develop strong relationships across a complex matrix of stakeholders.  As part of planning, you have ample experience in tracking, analysis, and delivering insights to produce successful marketing initiatives, inspire evolution and make recommendations for campaign and program optimizations. You want to be part of an exceptional team and have lots of fun delivering world-class work. This role is part brand planner, part content strategist, part digital strategist - with an absolute love of storytelling.  The successful candidate will have worked with world-class brands on digital and content marketing, social, product launches and seasonal campaigns. This position will be well-suited to an individual who is a creative thinker with strong analytical and research skills. A true collaborator, this role requires someone who is entrepreneurial, willing to go above and beyond the expected contribution to a given project specifically to help ensure the project and everyone involved achieve success. Education Bachelor’s degree in relevant subject

title: Growth Analytics Manager, Google Express
summary: Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus. As a Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating goals to project stakeholders. Your projects often span offices, time zones and hemispheres, and it's your job to keep all the players coordinated on the project's progress and deadlines.   Google Express aims to revolutionize shopping by offering fast and cheap delivery of merchant products to your door. Google Express is our company's vehicle to revolutionize this space and be a principal driver of commerce. We bring home-delivery nationwide shipping from stores from various merchants across the country. The Growth team is an integral part of Google Express, responsible for driving GMV growth on the platform.   You will be part of the Growth analytics team that is responsible for identifying growth trends and assessing key growth drivers. In this role, you will deliver actionable insights to key stakeholders in Growth and cross-functional teams including Product, Marketing and Engineering to help develop and prioritize projects that lead to growth through greater customer reach, engagement and retention.   Users come first at Google. Nowhere is this more important than on our Advertising & Commerce team: we believe that ads and commercial information can be highly useful to our users if, and only if, that information is relevant to what our users wish to find or do. Advertisers worldwide use AdWords to promote their products; publishers use AdSense to serve relevant ads on their website; and business around the world use our products (like Google Shopping, and Google Wallet) to support their online businesses and bring users into their offline stores. We build and maintain the platforms that have made Google what it is today, and are constantly innovating to deliver the most effective advertising and commerce opportunities of tomorrow.   Responsibilities Own weekly analysis of trends to identify actionable insights and opportunity areas for optimizing traffic, conversion and retention. Generate ideas, hypotheses and validate them with data to help Growth team initiate and carry out experiments and iterative tests. Conduct deep dives to identify growth drivers. Understand big-picture business objectives and develop appropriate statistical models (e.g., conversion factors, retention factors, customer segmentation) to deliver deeper insights. Determine the tracking necessary to enable requisite analytics and partner with business intelligence team to get it implemented. Partner with key stakeholders in Growth as well as cross-functional partners in Product and Engineering to support them in growth experimentation - test design, results analysis and reporting.  Qualifications Minimum qualifications: Master's degree with an emphasis on work of a quantitative nature (Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics) or equivalent practical experience. 5 years of work experience in an analytical role in Growth, Marketing, Product teams. Experience with statistical concepts to support A/B experimentation, analysis of results and deriving statistical learnings. Experience with SQL, analytical tools (Tableau, Google Analytics). Experience building quantitative and statistical models in R, Python working with databases.  Preferred qualifications: PhD degree with emphasis on coursework of a quantitative nature (Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics). Experience in identifying business opportunities and defining and measuring success of proposed initiatives. Similar work experience at an online consumer business (e.g., e-commerce, payments). Consulting or project/program management experience. Ability to handle multiple projects and assignments under time pressure. Excellent communication skills along with the ability to manage multiple and diverse stakeholders across businesses and leadership levels.

title: Projects and Analytics Manager, Security and Resilience
summary: From keeping Googler’s safe and secure to managing disruptive events, the ability to anticipate, deter, detect, and act are the pillars of Google’s Global Security and Resiliency Services (GSRS) team. As a member of GSRS you will help develop a culture where safety, security and resiliency are integrated into every facet of Google, including the creative process. You will help us continually identify, evaluate and monitor enterprise risks that could affect business activities and provide business leaders the information they need to make critical decisions. You'll collaborate with cross-functional teams to create innovative strategies and develop best in class programs that drive sustainable effectiveness.   Security is at the core of Google's design and development process: it is built into the DNA of our products. The same is true of our offices and workplaces. As a Projects and Analytics Manager, you'll partner with others in Google and delve into data, work on global risk modeling/dashboard projects and support concepts leading to the development of innovative security tools.   In this role, you will utilize the power of data to help us recognize trends, gain insight and help deter events that may threaten the safety of Googlers or disrupt business. Whether it’s finding new ways to measure, model, and optimize our security and resilience abilities or working with partners to learn new ways of conceptualizing risk and impact, you’ll identify and execute data-driven solutions to some of our thorniest challenges.   Just as Google products always focus on the user, Google offices focus on the Googler. From state-of-the-art green construction projects to maintaining our resident T. Rex skeleton (named Stan), the Real Estate and Workplace Services team builds environments that keep Googlers feeling inspired and energized. We're a team of inquisitive and energetic real estate, construction and facilities operations professionals that are constantly searching for new ways to improve workplace efficiency and make Google a great place to come to work everyday.   Responsibilities Develop, implement and refresh risk management tools, identifying and reviewing global security risks to Google in various geo-locations through multiple data and analytics resources. Partner with, and support teams to gather and analyze data and create risk models and viewing tools. Share results, trends and insights with leadership, helping to inform current and future risk-taking posture and risk mitigation strategies. Distribute workload, maintain project schedules and keep an eye on quality control across this highly creative and talented team.  Qualifications Minimum qualifications: Master's degree in engineering, macroeconomics, mathematics, finance, statistics or similar quantitative field, or equivalent practical experience. 7 years of experience building analytical and/or quantitative models in a team environment. Experience working with productivity and spreadsheet software, and SQL.  Preferred qualifications: 5 years of experience in analytical and/or quantitative modeling within the insurance, financial or investment industry. Knowledge of GIS (Geographic Information Systems) and proficient programming skills in Python, R and/or similar. Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to influence others. Effective data visualization skills, with the ability to simplify complex concepts.

title: Data Scientist - Psychometrician - People Analytics & Measurement
summary: Qualifications University degree; Advanced degree strongly preferred Background in I/O Psychology or training in a related discipline e.g., applied statistics, mathematics, social science research, operations research, econometrics, or related field 3-5 years of experience in people analytics or closely related field Fluency in a statistical software package, with a strong preference for the R ecosystem Proficiency in SQL, including experience retrieving data from production relational databases Theoretical understanding of, and experience applying, statistical methods such as factor analysis and logistic regression, including selection of appropriate techniques to real-world data sets Comfortable explaining measurement principles and common problems to audiences without a psychometric background Ability to communicate professionally with clients and engage in stakeholder discussion and clear commitment to quality and accuracy Demonstrated successful project management within a team Integrity and professionalism in dealing with confidential information Proactive self-starter with outstanding organizational and project management skills Ability to manage multiple work streams simultaneously  Who You'll Work With You will be based in Washington, DC or Atlanta and will be part of the People Analytics and Measurement team. This group designs and executes projects supporting McKinsey’s people mission: to build a great firm that attracts, develops, excites, and retains exceptional people. The team is a collection of bright, highly motivated researchers with varied backgrounds focused on driving insight and action around key strategic people issues at McKinsey. The team works in a highly collaborative environment, and partners with other teams within the firm to deliver meaningful innovation in people analytics.   You will serve a variety of internal clients including the Chief People Officer, People Committee, Operating Committee, Regional and Office leadership, key initiatives and task forces, Professional Development and Recruiting staff, and other communities within the firm.   What You'll Do You will lead key long-term projects in multiple topic areas across the people function.   These projects require conducting analytics, translating insights, and working with internal clients to drive impact. As the analytics agenda of the team develops, you will work in a number of areas including organizational analytics, network analytics, predictive analytics and NLP, advanced recruiting tools, surveys, automated reporting and metrics, and external HR technology.   You will design, validate, and analyze people measurement instruments, such as satisfaction surveys. You will also work with stakeholders, including firm leadership and other data scientists, to guide the development of instruments and accompanying analysis plans that address our key people research questions.   You will work closely with other data scientists to translate analytic insights and communicate them to internal clients using a variety of formats from regular static reports to reactive visualizations and presentations. Once you're established in the role, you'll coach team members and delegate project responsibilities. You'll also develop a broad and deep expertise in McKinsey’s evolving people structures and data.

summary: Whether you're on a consumer product (like Gmail, Search, Maps, Chrome, Android) or a business product (AdWords, AdSense, DoubleClick, Analytics), you take part in a complete marketing experience as you lead every facet of the product's journey. From determining positioning, naming, competitive analysis, feature prioritization and external communications, you help shape the voice of the product and help it grow a loyal consumer base. This means you work with a cross-functional team across sales, corporate communications, legal, webmasters, product development, engineering and more. In this role, you'll be involved with product marketing strategy from beginning to end.   As a Marketing Analyst working in the Google Cloud organization, you'll be a part of the Marketing Strategy team. You will help to define strategies in order to increase user acquisition and to drive pipeline growth, while also implementing data and reporting solutions, helping with campaign targeting, delivering insights and ROI analysis, and partnering with stakeholders across multiple functions and locations. The principal goal of your work will be to enable data-driven decisions across all marketing programs.   Google Cloud helps millions of employees and organizations empower their employees, serve their customers, and build what’s next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Analyze customer behavior to advise marketers on how to optimize their programs for maximum impact. Communicate effectively, present findings to multiple levels of stakeholders, and provide key strategic business recommendations. Articulate the compelling value proposition for their solutions and/or articulate how their solutions strengthens or expands the overall Knovel value proposition   • For content, the product manager shall cultivate relationships with subject matter experts and negotiate contracts with those experts to provide editorial support. S/he will work with content production team to develop specifications for content production. S/he will work with content licensing manager to make build/license decisions for necessary content   The Product Manager will work collaboratively with the engineering team to enhance/develop feature/function capabilities through an agile framework   KEY METRIC: Usage growth of structured data in charts/tables/databases   Go-to-Market  Spearhead go-to-market planning including pricing, packaging, and internal/external communications planning around new data products. Develop and deliver underlying material that can be used by marketing to articulate the value proposition to internal and external audiences.  KEY METRIC: Adoption of data solutions by existing customers and penetration in to new customers  Product Analytics  Use robust product management tools including usage data, user behaviors, A/B testing, interviews, surveys and other appropriate tools to continuously refine understanding of users and make data-driven recommendations for changes to existing capabilities and for new capabilities.  KEY METRIC: Insights developed from usage analysis and user interactions  Functional and Technical Competencies • A passionate champion of user needs and clearly articulate those needs in to a compelling value proposition. Prioritize those needs for execution based on understanding of overall product strategy, and market trends, including competition  • Experience in bringing together information and capabilities (e.g., analytics) to deliver the value proposition  • Work closely with the product, design, engineering, and marketing team to drive usage and awareness  • Experience with product management tools including usage analysis, user behavior, A/B testing to monitor product performance and effect changes to achieve key metrics  • Work with analytics team to build out dashboard and prioritization of business/product metrics.  • Effective time management and analytical/decision-making skills  • Excellent presentation skills to internal and external stakeholders. Strong track record of collaboration within teams  • Strong MS Excel or other data analysis tools (e.g., R) skills is an advantage  • Strong experience with analytics tools like Kibana, Qlik, Tableau is an advantage  Education, Knowledge, Skills and Experiences   • 5+ years of Product Management experience, preferably in developing and delivering building information driven B2B2C solutions   • Bachelor degree or higher degree in Science or Engineering field.   • Experience of working in, or supplying technology to, an industry served by Knovel: e.g. aerospace, chemicals, oil & gas, engineering & design, industrial machinery is an advantage.   • Some travel may be required.   Elsevier is the world's leading provider of scientific, technical and medical (STM) information, tools and resources. A global company based in Amsterdam, Elsevier partners with scientists, researchers, healthcare providers, educators and decision-makers in academic institutions, governments and corporations to help them find, evaluate and use information. Our breadth of content is unparalleled, spanning virtually every STM field in the world and includes such distinguished brands as Gray's Anatomy, The Lancet and Cell. Using innovative technology, we deliver our content through tools that help our customers be more productive and successful in their work. ScienceDirect delivers the worlds' leading journals electronically to over 11 million readers in 200 countries. And physicians in 95 percent of teaching hospitals rely on ClinicalKey to get critical information that can save lives. Elsevier employs over 7,000 people in more than 70 offices worldwide. We are an employer of choice, attracting and developing talented and creative people who thrive in a challenging and fast-paced environment. We offer an excellent compensation and benefits package as well as a real opportunity for career growth in a growing organization. Elsevier is an equal opportunity employer: qualified applicants are considered for and treated during employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, national origin, citizenship status, disability status, protected veteran status, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law. If a qualified individual with a disability or disabled veteran needs a reasonable accommodation to use or access our online system, that individual should please contact 1.877.734.1938 or accommodations@relx.com.

title: Director, Research & Consumer Insights
summary: Overview The Director of Research & Consumer Insights is responsible for developing and executing strategic research initiatives that benefit the tronc portfolio of news brands, generating brand, digital and advertiser marketing insights to fuel key work across the group, includes the Los Angeles Times, Chicago Tribune and New York Daily News.  The role will work in close partnership with the VP, Brand and Consumer Marketing to develop a research and insights function that drives action across lines of business, provides executive-level insight into the group’s consumer audiences, and creates opportunities for growth/revenue development. Using consumer research to drive collaboration, the role informs business strategies and works with key stakeholders to address critical business needs.  KEY RESPONSIBILITIES: Lead a team of internal researchers and external research partners to fulfill company’s research & insights agenda Create proposals and scope documents for research engagements Manage research outcomes with attention to business value and actionability Lead presentation and socialization of consumer insights across the organization Coordinate efforts to implement insights across the group, through collaboration on development of business strategy, marketing campaigns, and product development Lead the development of research plans that answer key questions across the consumer marketing (subscription sales, path to purchase, consumer segmentation) and advertising sales functions (category thought leadership, product research, audience development) Help refine value proposition and drive productive brand outcomes Act as the primary contact person for research partners and facilitate partner communications and logistics to ensure partners enjoy a positive and mutually beneficial experience working with tronc’s news brands  QUALIFICATIONS: BA/BS in marketing, business, communications, journalism or related field, MBA preferred 7-10+ years in roles developing consumer insights, market research, and/or strategic marketing roles Must possess excellent verbal and written communication skills and a strong strategic mindset Strong analytical skills; able to interpret and present data to provide insightful, tactical recommendations Highly proficient in business software (e.g. MS Word, Excel & PowerPoint) and primary research tools (e.g. Qualtrics) Knowledge of SAS, R or other statistical languages a plus Comfortable with general web analytics (Google Analytics, Omniture/Site Catalyst, etc) Experience in reporting and presenting to senior executives (C-suite level) Project management experience a plus Highly organized and detail-oriented; able to manage multiple projects simultaneously Must be able to travel as required

title: Associate Data Analyst
summary: Hulu is a premium streaming TV destination that seeks to captivate and connect viewers with the stories they love. We create amazing experiences that celebrate the best of entertainment and technology. We’re looking for great people who are passionate about redefining TV through innovation, unconventional thinking and embracing fun. It’s a mission that takes some serious smarts, intense curiosity and determination to be the best. Come be part of the team that’s powering play. SUMMARY Hulu’s Data and Analytics organization is seeking an Associate Data Analyst who will be an exceptional addition to our Reporting and Data Access team. As an Associate Data Analyst at Hulu, you will be responsible for turning data into information, information into insights and insights into key business decisions that steer the strategic direction of the company. The right person for this role has exceptional analytical capabilities, thrives in a fast-pace environment, loves problem-solving, is a strong communicator, and loves to have fun. If you are someone who gains personal satisfaction from transforming data into business insights, then this is a great role for you. WHAT YOU’LL DO Use internal and external analytics tools, SQL, and scripting languages to access and analyze multivariate data Interface with engineering and business units to drive and deliver key operational metrics and KPIs that enable business success and value-addition within the data and analytics domain Build data visualizations and cross-functional, enterprise reporting that conveys key performance metrics, significant trends, and relationships across multiple data sources Provide ad hoc analysis support to business units and key stakeholders for complex data questions In conjunction with Program Management, act as the main liaison between diverse business units reliant upon data and associated metrics and the relevant engineering teams within Hulu’s technology organization Translate business functional requirements into technical specifications for the associated engineering teams Provide educational and training support for reporting and data access to business stakeholders WHAT TO BRING A degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Operations Research, Information Systems, Economics, Computer Science, etc. 2+ years of experience as an analyst in a data and analytics domain Strong analytical skills – ability to read/write complex SQL queries to analyze data, investigate systemic defects and validate data quality Experience with data visualization tools (Tableau, MicroStrategy, etc.) coupled with strong story telling skills for technical and non-technical audiences Strong understanding of data warehousing concepts and design Experience working in a “big-data” environment (Hive, Presto, Hadoop, BigQuery) Understanding of the fundamentals of statistics applied to solving business problems Experience taking vague requirements and transforming them into crisp deliverables Exceptional written and oral communication skills that translate across technical and business stakeholders NICE-TO-HAVES Exposure to data modeling – both dimensional and relational is highly desired Familiarity with Data Science concepts a plus  We will consider for employment all qualified applicants, including those with criminal histories, in a manner consistent with applicable federal, state and local laws

title: Manager, Service Metrics and Analytics
summary: Job Description  This role is within the Service Management Office - Business Operations team of End User Systems (EUS). EUS is part of Corporate IT, a function that champions the technology needs of Visa staff. The Service Management Office (SMO) works with technology and business partners to provide a center of excellence within the organization to drive efficiency and effectiveness.. We are passionate about improving user effectiveness and increasing productivity by improving tools and services and empowering users with the information they need to be successful. We are looking for equally passionate people in this space to expand our team, specifically focused on analyzing and reporting metrics for End User technologies and to drive continuous improvements. Business Operations is the control office of the Service Management Office. The SMO brings a strategic approach to designing, delivering, managing and improving the way information technology is used within an organization. The goal of this team is to bring value to Visa business users in the form of IT services. It creates an easy and clear way for people to interact with IT and creates confidence in our ability to respond. This role is critical in that the metrics, data, and analysis brings evidence of improvement activities to a broad business and IT audience. This person will be responsible for supporting the overall process of compiling, designing, automating, analyzing and reporting on service quality and other cross-functional IT measures to technologists and senior management. There is a key focus on trending to identify continuous improvement activities. This is accomplished by collaborating with our Help Desk, onsite support, and service delivery teams. Additional data sources may be out of our department, therefore finding that data and collaborating with resources in other departments is essential. The Service Metrics Reporting Manager will leverage our systems, including ServiceNow, introduce new processes and data sources, and create measurable metrics from unstructured data and anecdotal feedback. Metrics must be accurate, concise, and meaningful. They should provide depth of information, while being easily consumable by stakeholders. Candidate will track metric performance against SLAs, identify and drive improvements to improve service levels. They will understand service delivery and the end user technology space. They will have proven skills in Excel, Tableau, Service Now and other tools as required to generate reports, dashboards, and scorecards. The successful candidate will have experience automating reports to reduce overhead and increase accuracy. The successful candidate will demonstrate not only data analytic skills, but also the ability to interpret data to provide knowledge and insight. Not just reporting what, but identifying why. They must be able to apply critical thinking skills to perform impact analysis and root cause analysis. They must recognize the necessity and value of accuracy, have a strong process documentation background, and process information quickly. The Manager, Service Metrics and Analytics will use their reports to create actionable activities. They will identify hot spots and priorities based on urgency and impact. They will create plans to manage and measure, with the outcome of improved services. The successful candidate must possess excellent interpersonal skills and be comfortable working with cross-functional IT organizations at all levels, including senior management. They are successful at working independently while managing relationships within a matrix organization and demonstrate excellent written and verbal communications skills. This role supports our ability to manage our services, tell the story honestly, identify opportunities, and measure success. Key Responsibilities:  Manage, evaluate and drive ongoing requests for reporting and data as needed by operational groups as well as projects. Identify, create and deliver IT service reporting, analyze metrics, and compare data from different sources to draw conclusions. Execute ad-hoc, monthly, quarterly and annual tasks related to reporting as needed. Drive the data collection requirements, analysis, reporting and improvements needed for service metrics. Create and manage Continual Improvement action plans. Work with partner groups including Finance, PMO, and other IT teams for metrics compilation responsibilities. Create communications and presentations that transform data into actionable information for various audiences including senior leadership team. Ensure accurate and timely reporting is done on all work related to scorecards. Socialize scorecards and improvement findings with various partners within IT and Business orgs. Develop key metrics, dashboards, and associated data views to support management decision makers. Provide ad-hoc analysis to support leadership decisions. Accountable for continuous service optimization, tracking and communicating as well as maintaining a comprehensive metrics catalogue. Qualifications  Experience in end user technologies, including collaboration, video, desktop, voice,  MS product suite, SharePoint, etc. is required Excellent Excel skills and familiarity with additional reporting tools including Tableau. Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or other related field or previous work experience. 8+ years of related work experience Experience coding in VBA Fully proficient in Microsoft office tools, with special focus on Microsoft Excel and its analytical capabilities (e.g. Macros/Visual Basic, pivot tables, data slicers etc.). Proficiency in use of and manipulation of data extracts and reporting techniques. Knowledge of Six Sigma and Statistical analysis preferred. Experience with ServiceNow reporting preferred Experience with presentation skills including executive materials to senior management preferred. The ability to deliver concise and accurate, reports that have business value. Proven ability to identify reporting gaps and create meaningful reports from scratch. Excellent verbal and written communication skills, problem solving skills, attention to detail, interpersonal skills and the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group of executives, managers, and subject matter experts. Strong ability to work independently and manage one's time. Must be able to integrate well into an existing team of technical and project  professionals. Strong knowledge of Office software, such as PowerPoint, Outlook, Excel, etc. Strong analytical skills required, including a thorough understanding of how to interpret customer business needs and translate them into visual and statistical artifacts. Excellent ability to translate data into information that “tells a story”, motivates stakeholders and drives improvement. Track record of dependable, on time deliveries. Ability to work effectively in a matrix organization. Additional Information  All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

title: Manager, Performance Marketing Analytics
summary: Starz is currently seeking a performance marketing insights and analytics leader to join the Insights and Analytics department. S/he will serve as a change agent in the company – developing and implementing strategies, techniques, and best practices to understand and optimize all direct to consumer acquisition and retention campaigns.  The candidate will be highly collaborative and work cross-functionally to help the marketing team achieve aggressive growth and retention targets. The role will serve as the primary department interface with the acquisition and retention team. The role is highly visible and includes senior management stakeholders within marketing and product.  Responsibilities: Lead the team in defining and managing strategic goals and deliverables across our marketing channels and track implementation success using data and analytics  Support acquisition and retention teams with deep and actionable insights via dashboards, analysis and ad hoc reporting requests  Provide informed recommendations for marketing executives and functional stakeholders regarding campaign creative and product attributes  Optimize all levels of sales funnel via timely and insightful analytics  Work closely with direct response agency to ensure every marketing dollar is spent as efficiently as possible – evaluate audiences and use complex models to assess optimal marketing mixes  Work closely with Director, Consumer Analytics and Director, Consumption Analytics to fuse survey/sample based insights, consumption metrics, and paid insights campaigns to develop clear and actionable audience and creative recommendations  Work with Exec Director, BI and Data Science in Insights and Analytics department to build descriptive analytics dashboards for all levels of organization, both within the marketing organization and among other departments.  Lead KPI sessions both by way of data collection and presentation in an effort to communicate the performance of the streaming product(s)  Contribute towards the creation of a data driven decisioning culture, by assisting those who need help accessing dashboards and helping them understand how the data relates to their day to day  Proactively review numbers frequently, perform the analysis required to understand or narrow the cause and alert relevant groups/departments  Required Skills  College degree and equivalent work experience. Graduate degree preferred  5+ years in marketing analytics driving acquisition and retention, experience with video subscription business a plus  4+ years in relational database (e.g., SQL) and unstructured databases (e.g., HADOOP)  2+ years’ experience working with the major analytics and attribution platforms: Google Analytics, Tune, MixPanel, etc  2+ years’ experience working with data visualization and business intelligence tools such as Tableau, Cognos, etc  2+ years’ experience developing marketing channel attribution structures and methodologies  Strong communications skills, including the ability to distill and relay data to a variety of audiences, including senior executives  Excellent verbal and presentation skills, must be comfortable presenting to large audiences, capable to answering questions about the data to top executives  History of ‘knowing the numbers’ able to tell when metrics are off and quickly bring to the attention of relevant individuals  Proven success at using analytics to meet aggressive acquisition goals  Deep understanding of optimization processes (e.g. A/B testing) and experimental design (e.g. identifying the variables, treatment structures, etc)  Deep understanding of data structures, data ingestion/publishing methods, SQL, and consumption tracking techniques  Experience working in corporate setting while having comfort with startup-like environment – experiment, fail fast, discern and share intelligence.  Occasional travel to New York  STARZ ( www.starz.com ), a Lionsgate company (NYSE: LGF.A, LGF.B), is a leading global media and entertainment company that provides premium subscription video programming on domestic U.S. pay television networks and produces and distributes content for worldwide audiences, including its investment in the STARZ PLAY Arabia OTT service.  STARZ is the ultimate destination for obsessable TV, movies and more. Characters who pull you in and stories that stay with you. From bold Original Series to the best movies, whatever you love, STARZ ignites your passions.  STARZ offers a competitive compensation package and an attractive benefits program to all eligible employees including a variety of healthcare plans, dental and vision insurance, 401k, life/disability insurance. Eligible employees will enjoy paid time off in the form of vacation and company holidays.  STARZ is an Equal Opportunity Employer. This means that all applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of gender, age, race, national origin, disability, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In addition, STARZ will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities.  Required Experience
